YoTDZ4ZY.title: Photodynamic effect of hypocrellin B liposome in Leghorn cock wattle
YoTDZ4ZY.abstract: Objective: To investigate photodynamic effect of hypocrellin B ( HB ) liposome by port wine stains(PWS) in Leghorn cock wattle as an animal model. Methods: Leghorn cocks (n = 14) were divided into the groups of control, laser or drug administration alone and photodynamic therapy ( PDT). The PDT cocks were intravenously injected with HB liposome at 0.25 and 0.5 mg·kg -1. Two areas with 1 cm diameter on each cock wattle were irradiated by 532 nm laser with the energy density of 60 or 120 J·cm-2, respectively, after intravenous injection of the photosensitiser. The power density was 100 mW·cm-2, and exposure time was 10 and 20 min, respectively. Gross appearances were recorded every day, and histological changes were observed 3 and 14 days after photodynamic therapy. Results; Epidermal damage and scabs occurred after treatment with photosensitiser at 0.25 or 0. 5 mg·kg-1, and wattles whitened obviously at 14 days after scab disappearance. The capillary net of cock wattle was destroyed, and the epidermal cells were proliferated. There was no obvious difference between the effects of both doses. The epidermal damage was obviously poorer after laser irradiation at 60 J·cm-2 than at 120 J·cm -2. Color fading was found in both dose groups. Conclusion; HB liposome can damage the capillary net of cock wattle and causes the reversible damage of normal epidermis.

CWC66NgZ.title: Influence of Laser Parameters on Temperature Distribution of Retina:a Theoretical Analysis
CWC66NgZ.abstract: Objective To investigate the influence of the different laser therapeutic parameters on the temperature distribution of retina in photody- namic therapy on ocular fundus diseases. Methods The influence of laser wavelength,power density and spot diameter on retina of chinchilla grey rabbits was analyzed theoreti- cally using the mathematical model established by us based on classical bio-heat transfer model-Permes equation. Results The results showed that laser wavelength,power density and spot diameter were important factors to affect temperature distri- bution.The temperature induced by 578 nm laser was the highest,and 532nm laser was next to it.The temperature induced by 690 nm laser was the minimum.With increasing in the power density and the spot diameter,retinal temperature raises too. Conclusions To prevent unwanted thermal damage,we must control strictly the laser parameters during photodynamic therapy on fun- dus diseases.

S3TZAaww.title: Long-term Effect of Photodynamic Therapy for Recurrent Gastric Cancer
S3TZAaww.abstract: Objective To observe the long-term effect of photodynamic therapy for recurrent cancer of gastric stump.Methods The PSD-007 or HpD at 5 mg/kg body weight for 36-48 hours was intravenously injected.According to the different sites of cancer recurrence in the gastric stump,the patient was irradiated with a gold vapor laser using a point-like optical fiber (627.8 nm of wavelength,power density of 100-200 mW/cm2,irradiation time of 20-30 minutes and light dose of 120-360 J/cm2).Endoscopy and pathological examination were conducted to evaluate the short-term and long-term effect of PDT.ResultsPDT was conducted at the site of cancer recurrence of each time.Endoscopic examination and pathological examination found no tumor cells at 4-5 weeks after PDT.Endoscopy and pathological examination at 5 to 10 years following up revealed no cancer recurrence at treatment area.No adverse events were seen during and after PDT.ConclusionsPDT is a safe,effective and minimally invasive treatment for recurrent cancer of gastric stump.PDT can be repeated to use without disturbance of the function and integrity of target organ,and can significantly improve patient's quality of life with good long-term effect.

578BvnKP.title: Polyethylene glycol-functionalized bis(arylidene)cycloalkanone photosensitizers for two-photon excited photodynamic therapy
578BvnKP.abstract: We report the properties of two series of polyethylene glycol- functionalized bis(arylidene)cycloalkanone photosensitizers designed for two-photon excited photodynamic therapy (PDT) with the aim to reveal the effect of the size of central ring on the two-photon excited PDT efficiency. These photosensitizers are the derivatives of bis(arylidene) cyclopentanone (B2, B3) and bis(arylidene) cyclobutanone (Q1-Q4). The bis(arylidene) cyclopentanone type photosensitizers were found to have larger two-photon absorption cross sections than the bis(arylidene) cyclopentanone ones with the same substituents. The singlet oxygen yields of the bis(arylidene) cyclobutanone derivatives are higher than the data of bis(arylidene) cyclopentanone derivatives. All the studied photosensitizers showed no obvious toxicity under dark situation. One- and two-photon excited PDT activities were successfully demonstrated by in vitro cell experiments. Owing to the capability of destructing the cancerous cells under two-photon irradiation, bis(arylidene)cycloalkanone based photosensitizers with proper substituents can be good candidates for two-photon excited PDT applications in the future. © Copyright SPIE.

UwYO4th6.title: Feasibility of light-emitting-diode applied to photodynamic therapy
UwYO4th6.abstract: The feasibility of light-emitting-diode (LED) applied to Photodynamic therapy (PDT) instead of laser in the field of space medicine is analyzed. The typical advantages of LED applied to PDT are introduced. Some experimental results show that LED can be used to PDT for various photosensitizers. The current situation of LED-PDT medical apparatus is mentioned. It is feasible that LED is used as the light source of PDT instead of laser. LED is a significant light source in the field of space medicine and plays a key role on the astronaut healthy support.

xh3ewJst.title: Principal Factors Affecting the Photobleaching Rate of HMME in Different Solutions
xh3ewJst.abstract: Objective To analyze the principal impact factors that can affect the photobleaching rate of HMME in different solutions. Methods Firstly, the principal impact factors that might affect the photobleaching process according to a theoretic photobleaching rate equation were deduced. Then the photobleaching data of HMME were calculated by measuring the absorbance values at different time before and after laser irradiation,and the photobleaching rates of HMME were compared by drawing photobleaching curves (HMME concentration-irradiation time). The main factors that could affect the photobleaching rate of HMME were analyzed by combining the theoretic deduction and experimental results. Results Photobleaching rates of HMME were different in different solutions:albumin solution > DMSO > cells suspension ≈ PBS. The molar extinction coefficients of HMME at 532nm laser irradiation in different solutions were: ε_ DMSO>ε_ cells-suspension>ε_ albumin-buffer >ε_ PBS. Conclusions Microenvironment of solutions can affect the photobleaching rates. The molar extinction coefficients and concentrations of photosensitizer are the principal impact factors. The photobleaching speeds up with the molar extinction coefficient of photosensitizer increased. Both albumin and DMSO can accelerate the photobleaching of HMME.

Mxz0DVED.title: Spectral measurement system and laser therapy experiments for port wine stains
Mxz0DVED.abstract: To measure and analyze the spectrum of a small skin region for laser therapy of port wine stain is very useful for clinical doctor to understand the optical characters of patient's pigmented skin, to adjust the output parameters of lasers and then to improve the therapy effects. Based on the analysis of the forming mechanism of port wine stains and clinical operation of the disease, the present paper presents an automatic spectral measurement and analysis system for port wine stain therapy. It can accomplish the spectral detection in the range from 380 to 780 nm, with a spectral resolution of 1 nm. Experiments were performed for patients with various age and pigment diseases; finally, some influencing factors and relevant solutions are enumerated and discussed.

AzW7zr1w.title: Assessment of tissue perfusion changes in port wine stains after vascular targeted photodynamic therapy: a short-term follow-up study.
AzW7zr1w.abstract: The occlusion effect of vascular targeted photodynamic therapy (V-PDT) for malformed vessels in port wine stains (PWS) often last for some time after the treatment. A relatively longer period after V-PDT is needed to accurately assess the final response of PWS microcirculation to the treatment. In this study, we intended to use laser speckle imaging (LSI) to assess the tissue perfusion changes of PWS at follow-up after V-PDT and preliminarily analyze the relationship between perfusion change and color bleaching. Seventeen patients with 40 PWS lesions were scanned by LSI before and 3-6 months after they received V-PDT. The speckle flow indices of PWS lesions and normal skin before and at follow-up after V-PDT were recorded. We also performed analyses on the correlation between perfusion changes and color bleaching. Before V-PDT, the 40 PWS lesions showed higher perfusion than the normal skin (1,421 ± 463 and 1,115 ± 386 perfusion unit (PU), respectively, P < 0.01). The PWS lesions scanned at follow-up showed decreased perfusion level compared to the preoperative values (1,282 ± 460 and 1,421 ± 463 PU, respectively, P < 0.01). After V-PDT, the perfusion change rates coincide well with the color bleaching rates (correlation coefficient, 0.73). In conclusion, the LSI system is capable of imaging PWS perfusion precisely, and it has shown promising results in assessing the changes of tissue perfusion of V-PDT for PWS, with objective and quantitative data, real-time images, and a shorter detection time. It may also provide an effectiveness assessment method for the treatment of PWS.

pVYGw2ZY.title: Changes of skin perfusion after photodynamic therapy for port wine stain.
pVYGw2ZY.abstract: To obtain an objective assessment of the curative effectiveness of photodynamic therapy (PDT) for port wine stain (PWS), we investigate the relationship between the microvascular perfusion changes of PWS and the blanching of the lesions before and after PDT.Twenty-four patients (18 females and 6 males with a total of 28 lesions) suffering from PWS were treated with PDT. The lesions of various extents were located on the face and neck. After intravenous injection of photosensitizer hepatoporphyrin derivative (HpD), the copper vapor laser was adopted as light source and the lesions of PWS were irradiated. The laser Doppler perfusion imager (LDI) was used to measure the microcirculatory perfusion of PWS before and after PDT and comparison with the normal skin was done.All the lesions showed remarkable decrease of tissue perfusion after PDT. It was shown that the mean, maximal and minimal values of tissue perfusion in the pre-treatment group were significantly higher than those in control group (P < 0.01). Six months after PDT, the mean, maximal and minimal values of perfusion with the lesions were reduced, with significant difference from pre-treatment group (P < 0.01), but no significant difference from control's. The colors of lesions were correlated with decrease of microcirculatory perfusion, which became lightened close to normal skin color without causing any scarring.PDT is one of the most effective modalities for PWS. The microcirculation perfusion can reflect the degrees of PWS objectively. The curative effectiveness of PDT for PWS is due to tissue microcirculation response.

IczPNiAc.title: Imaging of skin microvessels with optical coherence tomography: potential uses in port wine stains.
IczPNiAc.abstract: The knowledge of vascular structures of port wine stains (PWSs) may be useful to select treatment doses and improve therapeutic efficacy. Biopsies are impractical to implement, therefore, it is necessary to develop non-invasive techniques for morphological evaluation. This study aimed to evaluate the application of a novel optical coherence tomography (OCT) system to characterize the vascular structures of PWSs. First, OCT images were obtained from the skin of healthy rabbit ears and compared with the histopathological images. Second, OCT was used to document the differences between PWS lesions and contralateral normal skin; the size and depth of the vascular structures of two clinical types of PWSs were measured and statistically analyzed. The dermal blood vessels of healthy rabbit ears were clearly distinguished from other tissue. There was no statistical difference between the vascular diameter or depth measured by OCT images and histopathological sections (P>0.05). The OCT images of the PWSs could be distinguished from normal skin. There was no statistical difference in the depth of vessels between the purple-type and the proliferative-type PWSs (P>0.05), while there was statistical difference in the diameter of vessels between them (P<0.01). Therefore, OCT is a promising, real-time, in vivo and non-invasive tool with which to characterize the vascular structures of PWSs.

3nVcAsd9.title: Characteristics of damage by photodynamic therapy for muscle tissue and effect of dosage alteration on depth of action
3nVcAsd9.abstract: AIM: To observe the characteristicS of the change of the muscular injury caused by photodynamic therapy (PDT), and observe the effect of light and photosensitizer dose changes on the damage depth. METHODS: The experiment was carried out in the laboratory of Department of Laser Medicine, General Hospital of Chinese PLA between June 2004 and March 2005. ① Twelve New Zealand rabbits' muscle in the lower extremity was irradiated by 632.8 nm laser with a power density of 200 mW/cm2 for 15 minutes, which was performed at 5 minutes after photosensitizer PSD-007 (10 mg/kg) was intravenously injected. Macroscopic and light microscopic observations were performed immediately, at 3 days, 3 and 6 weeks after irradiation. ② Twenty New Zealand rabbits were divided into 4 groups with 5 rabbits in each group: high power and high dosage group (power density: 400 mW/cm2, PSD-007: 10 mg/kg), high power and low dosage group (power density: 400 mW/cm2, PSD-007: 5 mg/kg), high power and high dosage group (power density: 200 mW/cm2, PSD-007: 5 mg/kg), high power and high dosage group (power density: 200 mW/cm2, PSD-007: 10mg/kg). In all the four groups, the muscle was irradiated for 15 minutes. Histological characters were observed at 3 weeks after irradiation and the damage depth was measured with micrometer. RESULTS: Totally 32 rabbits were involved in the analysis of results. ① Results of gross observation and pathological characters in the irradiated area: There was no obvious change immediately after irradiation. The irradiated muscular cell became change of degeneration, necrosis and being absorbed subsequently with the inflammatory cell infiltration and collagen proliferation at 3 days after irradiation. ② Measured results of injured depth: The rise of light dose increased the damage depth. The injured depth was the severest in the high power and high dosage group [(3.87 ±0.40)mm], but the lightest in the low power and low dosage group [(2.36 ±0.33) mm]. The dosage changes had no obviously influence on the injured depth. CONCLUSION: The pathological change in muscle tissue caused by PSD-007-PDT is a reparative process after damage, the depth of which is mainly determined by light dose.

tR1JHhEA.title: Fluorescence spectroscopy study on photobleaching properties of photosensitizers in photodynamic therapy
tR1JHhEA.abstract: The photobleaching and formation of photoproduct of hematoporphyrin monomethyl ether (HMME) was investigated in solution by fluorescence spectroscopy. Irradiation was performed by 532 nm double-frequency Nd : YAG laser at a fluence rate of 100 mW x cm(-2), meanwhile the collection of fluorescence spectra was implemented an by optical multi-channel analyzer (OMA). Utilizing the basis spectra constructed and least-square fitting, the intensity of HMME fluorescence (613 nm), photoproduct fluorescence (639 nm) and autofluorescence can be resolved respectively from the single measured spectrum. The correlation between fluorescence intensity and the concentration of HMME is consistent with linear function at concentrations not exceeding 10 microg x mL(-1). Monitoring the fluorescence spectroscopy during irradiation, three kinds of information were obtained, including photobleaching of HMME, formation and bleaching of photoproduct, as well as variation to fluorescence intensity due to the change of sample optical properties. Product generated by bleaching of photoproduct causes significant in sample optical properties. The implementation of fluorescence spectroscopy measurement and spectral analysis method presented here can be utilized effectively for both ex vivo investigation of photobleaching characteristics of photosensitizer and in vivo monitoring for dosimetry in photodynamic therapy.

FaKyawwj.title: Polyethylene glycol-functionalized benzylidene cyclopentanone dyes for two-photon excited photodynamic therapy.
FaKyawwj.abstract: A series of polyethylene glycol-functionalized benzylidene cyclopentanone dyes with varying lipid/water partition coefficients were synthesized in high yields by a simple process. Detailed characterization and systematic studies of these molecules, including linear and nonlinear photophysical properties, reactive oxygen yields, and in vitro photodynamic therapy (PDT) activities, were conducted. Four of these dyes exhibited good solubility in PBS (>2 mg ml(-1), which is sufficient for clinical venous injection), high reactive oxygen yields, large two-photon absorption and low dark toxicity, under the therapy dosage. Among them, two dyes could be absorbed efficiently by human rectal cancer 1116 cells, and presented strong two-photon excited PDT activity in in vitro cell experiments.

VDgBloyb.title: Laser medicine
VDgBloyb.abstract: Laser medicine is a newly expanding subject that developed with the invention of the laser.In this paper,we review the history and clinical applications of laser medicine,including problems existing at the present stage.Currently,high and low power laser treatment and photodynamic therapy are the main treatment procedures,while many advanced laser diagnosis techniques have been developed.Future developments of the various laser treatment and laser diagnosis techniques are also discussed.

3nU2umnR.title: Retinal Injury of Gray and White Rabbits by 578.2 nm Copper Vapor Laser:a Comparison
3nU2umnR.abstract: Objective Using the 578.2 nm laser pulses with pulsewidths of 20-40 ns on the retinas of rabbit eyes with different pigment quantity, to compare the retinal injury thresholds in different rabbit eyes. Methods Thirty-two eyes of 16 gray rabbits and 26 eyes of 13 white rabbits were exposed to the laser with wavelengths of 578.2 nm, with the duration of 100 s and the spot size of 2 mm.The gray rabbits were grouped by density as 435 mW/cm~2,869 mW/cm~2,1 304 mW/cm~2,1 948 mW/cm~2 and 2 898 mW/cm~2.The white rabbits were grouped by density as 869 mW/cm~2,1 304 mW/cm~2,1 593 mW/cm~2,2 174 mW/cm~2 and 3 043 mW/cm~2.The authors examined and scored all laser impact spots in the retina ophthalmoscopically -with fundus photography to identify the evidencte of visible laser effects at 24 h after exposure and to observe the hurted tissues under the fundus pototgraphy and the microscope. Results Under the same laser exposing condition with the wavelengths of 578.2 nm,the duration of 100 s and the spot size of 2 mm, the retina of the gray rabbits was hurted more seriously than the white rabbits. Conclusions At the same expose time and the same light spot diameter,the different pigment quantity of eyes is the very important element to determine the laser retinal biology effect.

HtDwYeH8.title: Synthesis and bio-evaluation of novel hypocrellin derivatives: Potential photosensitizers for photodynamic therapy of age-related macular degeneration
HtDwYeH8.abstract: The phototherapeutic window from 600 to 900 nm is necessary for photodynamic therapy (PDT) of solid tumors, but may not suitable for PDT of some microvascular diseases, like age-related macular degeneration (AMD), because of its deep penetration. Moreover, absorption of some neighboring photoreceptors should be avoided for PDT of AMD. Considering these, yellow-orange light may be a proper phototherapeutic window of AMD. Herein, two novel amino-alkyl-sulfonic acid-substituted hypocrellin B derivatives, 3 and 4 were designed and synthesized. They exhibited the maximal absorption at yellow-orange light, and possessed higher PDT activity than 2, proved by the in vitro or in vivo experiments. Besides, 4 showed much higher PDT activity than 3, ascribed to its higher cellular uptake suggested by its optimized amphiphilicity and liposome-mimic results. And the vascular leakage of 4 was close to 2. Consequently, 4 has great potential for PDT of AMD or other superficial diseases. © 2013 Published by Elsevier Ltd.

Mp2iSgbF.title: Monte Carlo simulation of detecting the severity of port wine stains by spectroscopy technology
Mp2iSgbF.abstract: A nine-layer optical model of port wine stain skin (PWS) was developed based on the analysis of PWS pathology. Using this model the theoretical reflectance and fluorescence spectra of PWS at various severity and that of normal skin were obtained by Monte Carlo simulation. The result shows that the severity of PWS, the changes of blood vessel diameter in particular, can be detected by reflectance and fluorescence spectra. When blood vessel diameter increases, both the reflectance and the fluorescence intensity of PWS skin decrease obviously. This suggests that both the reflectance and fluorescence spectra can be applied to diagnose and analyze the severity of PWS and can offer guidance for more efficiently planning clinical therapies of PWS.

xXMhU4E6.title: PDT Using to Purify Hematopoietic Stem Cell:Current Research Status
xXMhU4E6.abstract: With the profound study of PDT mechanism and the new type of photosensitive drugs,the using of PDT has been expanded to many neoplastic diseases and nontumorous diseases.The neoplastic diseases include skin cancer,stomach cancer,esophageal carcinoma and so on.The nontumorous diseases include port wine stains(PWS),age related macula degeneration,acne and others.In recent years,using PDT to purify hematopoietic stem cells(HSC) has become a new domain in application of PDT.Experiments have proved this method can kill many kinds of tumor cells effectively,such as leukemia and lymphadenoma without cell cycle specificity,and could be equally use to drug fast tumor cell with very little cell damage to the normal HSC.Now,the experimental and clinical research of using PDT to purify HSC has become the hot spot for the domestic and world scholars.

0H515Ie3.title: Animal Experiment of the Port Wine Stains' Treatment by Photodynamic Therapy with Two Dosage Form of Hypocrellin B
0H515Ie3.abstract: Objective: Micro-emulsion Hycoprellin B (HB) and lipidosome HB in their effectiveness of photodynamic therapy on port wine stains' animal model or not,and their effect and side-effect in photodynamic therapy.Method: 32 leghorn cocks were divided into control group,HMME group,lipidosome 0.5 mg/kg group,lipidosome 1.0 mg/kg group,micro-emulsion 0.5 mg/kg group and micro-emulsion 1.0 mg/kg group.A spot with diameter 1 cm on cock comb was irradiated immediately by 532 nm laser with power density 100 mW/cm2 and energy density 100 J/cm2 after photosensitiser intravenous injection.Visual observation and photos were recorded every day,and pathology was determined 14 days later after photodynamic therapy.Results: 6 cases in HMME group showed medium reaction which is decreasing of microvasculature in shallow dermis and light scab.5 cases in lipidosome-HB 0.5 mg/kg group and 6 cases in micro-emulsion 0.5 mg/kg group showed severe reaction which is epidermis hyperplasia,decreasing of microvasculature in shallow dermis and medium dark scab.6 cases in lipidosome-HB 1.0 mg/kg group and 5 cases in micro-emulsion 1.0 mg/kg group show very severe reaction which is necrosis under scar,epidermis hyperplasia,almost no microvasculature in shallow dermis and very thick dark scab.Conclusions: The photodynamic therapy effectiveness with both micro-emulsion HB and lipidosome HB is similar,and has severe damage on microvasculature.But the damage of normal epidermis and dermis is severe too.

7iVh9QqW.title: The potential of photodynamic therapy to treat esophageal candidiasis coexisting with esophageal cancer.
7iVh9QqW.abstract: Photodynamic therapy (PDT) has been used in recent years to deal with fungal infections because of the prevalence of fungi resistance to drugs. However, PDT for gastrointestinal fungal infection has not been reported. This study was conducted to assess the potential of PDT to deal with esophageal candidiasis.Two male patients with histological evidence of esophageal candidiasis coexisting with esophageal cancer were included in this retrospective study. Both patients were treated with PDT. This treatment was repeated at least 1month after the initial PDT if the patient still had residual cancer or esophageal candidiasis. Short-term efficacy was evaluated on the basis of endoscopy and histology findings. Further follow-up data were obtained from endoscopy results or telephone conversation.The esophageal candidiasis located 21-24cm and 25-28cm from the incisors of case 1 reached complete remission after one and two PDT sessions, respectively. The esophageal cancer coexisting with esophageal candidiasis located 21-24cm from the incisors reached complete remission after two PDT sessions. No recurrence was found at a 14-month follow-up. The esophageal cancer located 30-35cm from the incisors reached partial response after three PDT sessions. Both of the esophageal candidiasis and the coexisting esophageal cancer at 23-26cm from the incisors of case 2 reached complete remission and the esophageal cancer at 34-37cm from the incisors reached complete remission after one PDT session. No recurrence was found at a 24-month follow-up. There were no serious adverse events found in either of the two cases.Results of this preliminary study indicate that PDT may be a potential method to deal with esophageal candidiasis.

Y823h1FA.title: Mathematics Modeling and Clinic Experiment of Photodynamic Therapy for Port Wine Stain
Y823h1FA.abstract: Treatment of port wine stain(PWS) by photodynamic therapy(PDT) has been under development over last years.To study the acting factors on vascular selectivity of photodynamic and help the doctor confirm therapy plan in clinic,the mathematics modeling of photodynamic therapy treating port wine stain is built.The modeling include light distribution in tissue,production of singlet oxygen,diffusion of photosensitizers and photobleaching.Using the model,a problem of therapeutic effect in clinic is analyzed and a new therapy scheme is recommended.The scheme is proved to be effective in the clinic experiment.

YI2Wj6BC.title: Spectral Properties of Five Hypocrellin Derivatives
YI2Wj6BC.abstract: Objective To study the absorption spectral properties of five hypocrellin derivatives.Methods The absorption spectra of THB,3HB,4HB,3SB, 4SB and HB (8μM/ml in PBS and 35μM/ml in DMSO) were measured with UV-vis spectrophotometer. The absorption and emission spectral 4SB and HpD were measured in PBS or mixed 20μM HSA in PBS.ResultsCompared with the parent, HB, the absorbance of each derivative in tumor phototherapy window (600-900 nm) was remarkably enhanced. The absorption spectra shifted (1-15 nm) toward the red side after HB and its derivatives were bound to HSA.The absorbance intensity was increased. The absorbance of HB rose by 100%.The fluorescence peak of 4SB shifted 20 nm toward the blue side and the intensity was 9 times higher than in PBS. ConclusionsHaving the potential to become valuable photosensitizers, the five hypocrellin derivatives analyzed hereunder are worth further studying.

GMqoBJBr.title: Investigation of photodynamic therapy optimization for port wine stain using modulation of photosensitizer administration methods.
GMqoBJBr.abstract: To raise photosensitizer concentration level during the photodynamic therapy process, two new methods of photosensitizer administration were investigated. The first method involves the slow intravenous injection of photosensitizer throughout the first 15 min of irradiation, and the second method involves 30 min fomentation before photosensitizer injection and irradiation. The fluorescence spectra of port wine stain skin were monitored and the therapeutic effect correlated index was calculated with a previously published spectral algorithm. Thirty cases were divided into group A (slow injection of photosensitizer during the first 15 min), group B (fomentation), and group C (control group, traditional injection method), with 10 cases in each group. To analyze the effect of these two new methods, the change of therapeutic effect correlated index values of two photodynamic therapy sessions for each patient were calculated, and the photodynamic therapy outcome was compared. The results showed that the change of therapeutic effect correlated index in group A was slightly more remarkable than that in the control group. The change of therapeutic effect correlated index in group B was similar to that in the control group. Slow injection of photosensitizer during photodynamic therapy has a potential to increase photosensitizer concentration level during photodynamic therapy. However, fomentation before photodynamic therapy has no such potential. There is a need for new methods to be attempted.

EE3Br1MD.title: Effect of HMME-PDT with Different Parameters on Hypertrophic Scarring in Rabbit Ear Model
EE3Br1MD.abstract: Objective To investigate the effect of hematoporphyrin monomethyl ether-photodynamic therapy(HMME-PDT) with different parame- ters on hypertrophic scar in the rabbit ear. Methods The acute model of dermal hypertrophic scar in the rabbit ear was established.Totally 150 scar wounds were randomly divid- ed into 2 groups:the experimental group received HMME-PDT with different parameters,and the control group received no special treatment.Specimens were harvested from scar wounds on day 28 postoperation.Scar and hypertrophic index(HI) were observed by hematoxylin-eosin staining. Results Compared with the control group,HMME-PDT in the experimental group (photosensitizer dose 10 mg/kg,power density 20 mW/cm~2,energy fluence 5 J/cm~2) reduced scar formation and decreased the HI. Conclusions HMME-PDT may play a role in inhibiting hypertrophic scarring in rabbit ear.The biological effect is determined by dose of photosensitizer,interval of photosensitizer injection and irradiation,power density and energy fluence.

8WEbwSbq.title: Comparative Study on Hypocrellin B and Hypocrellin B-derivatives Induced Photodynamic Effects to Gastric Adenocarcinoma Cell Line
8WEbwSbq.abstract: Objective The photodynamic therapy(PDT) effects and cytotoxicity per se of 17-5-amino-1-pentane-sulfonicacid-hypocrellin B(PENSHB)and 15-deacetyl-13-3-amino-1-propane-sulfonic acid-hypocrellin B(DPROHB)have been studied and compared with the parent hypocrellin B(HB).The PDT effects of these two new photosensitizers have been evaluated. Methods The BGC-823 cells were incubated with PENSHB,DPROHB or HB in different concentrations.Light-dependent cytotoxicity: cells were irradiated by KTP laser under wavelength 532nm with power density of 20mW/cm2 for 1000s.The cytotoxicity per se: cells were incubated as above without irradiation.Cell survival rates were measured by MTT assay respectively.Cell survival relationship with concentrations based on photosensitisers was plotted and polynomial curved.Light-induced cytotoxicity IC50(50% inhibition concentration) of each photosensitizer was derived.The safety coefficient for the photosensitizers was calculated based on the dark and light-induced cytotoxicity. Results Light-dependent cytotoxicity IC50 of PENSHB,DPROHB and HB was 26.22,28.14 and 48.03 nM,respectively.The statistical difference existed between HB and its derivatives,whereas no such difference was observed between PENSHB and DPROHB.The cytotoxicity per se IC50 of three photosensitizers was 3.42、4.20 and 4.48 μM,respectively,without statistical difference between each other.The safety coefficients of the individual photosensitizer were 130,173 and 93. Conclusions PENSHB and DPROHBP were better in PDT effect on BGC-823 cells and safer than HB.The cytotoxicity perse of three photosensitizers has no difference.

dPmHCrl0.title: Phototoxic effect of HB-PDT on DDP-resistant and non-DDP-resistant lung cancer cell lines:a comparative study
dPmHCrl0.abstract: Objective:To compare the reactivity of multidrug-resistant and non-drug-resistant lung cancer cell lines to hypocrellin B and photodynamic therapy(HB-PDT),and to study whether there is difference in the reactivities of multidrug-resistant lung cancer cell line to HB-PDT and chemotherapy.Methods: Human lung adenocarcinoma cell line A549 and DDP-induced multidrug-resistant cell line A549/DDP were separately incubated with different concentrations of HB,then irradiated by copper vapor laser with mixed wavelength light under saturated light dose.The survival rates of cells were measured by MTT assay 24 h after incubation.Accordingly cell survival curves of the 2 cell lines were drawn,the equations were derived and IC_(50) of each cell line was calculated.Results: HB-PDT had strong phototoxic effect on both DDP-resistant and non-DDP-resistant lung cancer cell lines.The IC_(50) values of HB to A549 and A549/DDP were 33.82 ng/ml and 34.19 ng/ml,respectively(P>0.05);the IC_(50) values of DDP to A549 and A549/DDP were 1.06 μg/ml and 8.06 μg/ml,respectively(P<0.01).HB-PDT and DDP had significantly different killing effects on multidrug-resistant A549/DDP cells(P<0.01).Conclusion: The phototoxic effects of HB-PDT on DDP-resistant lung cancer cell lines have no significant difference.HB-PDT has strong phototoxic effect on DDP-resistant and non-DDP-resistant lung cancer cell line and its killing effect is superior to that of DDP.The phototoxic effects of HB-PDT to DDP-resistant and non-DDP-resistant lung cancer cell line are not significantly different.HB-PDT may become an effective therapy for DDP-resistant lung cancer.

a34Qz80s.title: Eco-friendly synthesis of size-controllable amine-functionalized graphene quantum dots with antimycoplasma properties.
a34Qz80s.abstract: Size-controllable amine-functionalized graphene quantum dots (GQDs) are prepared by an eco-friendly method with graphene oxide sheets, ammonia and hydrogen peroxide as starting materials. Using a Sephadex G-25 gel column for fine separation, for the first time we obtain GQDs with either single or double layers. By atomic force microscopy characterization, we confirm that hydrogen peroxide and ammonia play a synergistic role on graphene oxide (GO), in which the former cuts the GO into small pieces and the latter passivates the active surface to give amine-modified GQDs. Due to the low cytotoxicity and excellent biocompatibility of the obtained amine-functionalized GQDs, besides the multiwavelength imaging properties of GQDs, for the first time we find that this kind of GQD exhibits good antimycoplasma properties. Given the superior antimycoplasma effect of the GQDs and their eco-friendly mass production with low cost, these new GQDs may offer opportunities for the development of new antimycoplasma agents, thus extending their widespread application in biomedicine.

ZnPfbQtK.title: Effect of hematoporphyrin monomethyl ether-mediated photodynamic therapy on hypertrophic scar fibroblasts.
ZnPfbQtK.abstract: Clinical studies have demonstrated that photodynamic therapy (PDT) for hyperplastic dermatosis results in a beneficial outcome. Hypertrophic scar (HS) is a pathological process characterized by fibroblastic hyperproliferation. However, it is unclear whether photochemical interactions between PDT and fibroblasts contribute to a beneficial outcome. To investigate the primary photochemical effects of PDT, we studied the efficacy of 630 nm PDT on human fibroblasts from HS using hematoporphyrin monomethyl ether (HMME) as a photosensitizer.Fibroblasts were cultured from nontreated HSs, and cells at passage 4-6 were used for the experiments. Morphological and biochemical changes in fibroblasts were assessed by Hoechst 33258 staining and annexin V-FITC/PI flow cytometry (FCM). Caspase-3 activity assay and immunofluorescence staining were performed to investigate caspase-3 expression in fibroblasts.The morphological features of cell apoptosis were viewed under a fluorescent microscope by Hoechst 33258 staining. FCM indicated that the apoptotic rate was significantly increased after HMME-PDT, and caspase-3 activity was observed.Low-level exposure to 630 nm PDT mediated by HMME appears to induce fibroblast apoptosis and stimulate caspase-3 activation. However, the effect of HMME-PDT on fibroblasts needs further investigation to determine its therapeutic potential for HS.

0OAZHVB3.title: Endoscopic Holmium Laser Treatment for Gastrointestinal Polyps:a Nursing Report
0OAZHVB3.abstract: Objective To discuss the nursing care for gastrointestional polyp treated by Ho ∶YAG laser through endoscopy.Methods A retrospective analysis of 88 cases with of a variety of gastrointestinal polyps and endoscopic application of holmium laser treatment in the process of care measures was carried out.Results Eighty-eight cases of gastrointestinal polyps were treated with holmium laser,from them 84 cases were effective,with a total effective rate of 95.5% and without complications due to nursing care.Conclusions The preoperative health education aimed to the different patients,the intraoperative and postoperative clinical observation and rehabilitation care are important for successful treatment.

dMdDFDcR.title: Photodynamic Therapy for Advanced Esophageal Cancer
dMdDFDcR.abstract: Objective To observe the short-term effect of photodynamic therapy for advanced esophageal cancer.Methods After intravenous injection of PSD-007 at 5mg/kg for 6 hours,the patient with advanced esophageal carcinoma was irradiated with a semiconductor laser using a cylindrical fiber(630nm wavelength,power density of 150mW/cm2,irradiation time of 30 minutes,and a total light dose of 270J/cm2).Endoscopy and pathological examination were conducted to evaluate the short-term effect at 5 weeks after PDT.ResultsObstructive symptoms of the patient disappeared at one week after PDT.Endoscopic examination revealed the original lesion disappeared completely and pathological examination found no tumor cells at 5 weeks after PDT.No adverse events were seen during and after PDT.ConclusionsPDT is a safe and effective treatment for advanced esophageal cancer,and can significantly improve quality of life of patient.

dHT5E8MX.title: In vitro photodynamic inactivation effects of Ru(II) complexes on clinical methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus planktonic and biofilm cultures.
dHT5E8MX.abstract: Photosensitizers (PSs) combined with light are able to generate antimicrobial effects. Ru(II) complexes have been recognized as a novel class of PSs. In this study, we investigated the effectiveness of photodynamic inactivation (PDI) mediated by three Ru(II) polypyridine complexes, 1-3, against four isolates of clinical methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus (MRSA-1, MRSA-2, MRSA-3 and MRSA-4). In PDI of a planktonic culture of MRSA-1, compound 3 showed the highest efficacy, likely owing to its advantageous light absorption, (1) O2 quantum yield and bacterial cellular binding. The PDI efficacy of 3 was further evaluated against all other strains and MRSA-1 biofilms. At appropriate PS concentrations, viability reduction of 100% or 96.83% was observed in planktonic or biofilm forms of MRSA, respectively. The mechanisms of action were investigated using negative staining transmission electron microscopy (TEM), confocal laser scanning microscopy (CLSM) and scanning electron microscopy (SEM). It was demonstrated that PDI of planktonic bacteria was achieved primarily through damage to the cell envelope. Biofilms were eliminated through both the destruction of their structure and inactivation of the individual bacterial cells. In conclusion, Ru(II) complexes, especially 3, are potential candidates for the effective photodynamic control of MRSA infections.

hXc0l2Q4.title: Photodynamic Therapy for Early Esophageal Cancer
hXc0l2Q4.abstract: Objective To assess the effect of photodynamic therapy(PDT) on early-stage esophageal cancer.Methods After intravenous injection of PSD-007 at 5 mg/kg for 6 hours,the patient had esophageal carcinoma in situ was irradiated with a semiconductor laser using a cylindrical fiber(630 nm wavelength,power density of 150 mW/cm2,irradation time of 30 minutes,a total light dose of 270 J/cm2).The follow up time was from 1 to 8 weeks.Results The esophageal carcinoma in situ of the patient was successfully treated after one treatment of PDT.No adverse reactions were seen during and after operation.Conclusions PDT is a highly effective,safe,highly selective and minimally invasive method for early esophageal cancer.

4byDDhoy.title: Photodynamic Therapy on Refractory Benign Skin Diseases and Its Progress
4byDDhoy.abstract: Photodynamic therapy involves selective photosensitization of a target tissue by means of administering photosensitizers topically or systemically, then activated by light. The special mechanism of PDT makes itself possess good cosmetic result and can be treated repeatly without drug resistance.Once it was used mainly for patients with skin cancers, more recently it has been investigated for treatment of several refractory benign skin diseases, such as inflammatory diseases, infective viral and fungal skin diseases, et al, with very promising result. However, there still need lots of comparative studies and optimized therapeutic protocols to determine the position of PDT treatment to the above diseases.

ylTeHSpc.title: Absorption Characteristics of Two Novel Hypocrellin B Derivatives in BGC-823 Cell
ylTeHSpc.abstract: Objective The purpose of this study is to investigate the absorptive characteristics of 17-5-amino-1-pentane-sulfoicacid-hypocrellin B(PENSHB) and 15-Deacetyl-13-3-amino-propane-sulfonic acid-hypocrellin B(DPROHB). Methods Human Gastric Adenocarcinoma Cells(BGC-823) were cultured,and PENSHB or DPROHB having a concentration of 4 μM was added to the culture medium.Then,they were incubated for different periods.Samples were measured with spectrofluorophotometer to get the curve of relationship between cell content and photosensitizer incubation period.The BGC-823 cells were incubated with PENSHB and DPROHB at different concentrations for 4 hours,then the relationship between the cell content and incubation concentration of the photosensitizers was plotted. Results he absorption curves of PENSHB and DPROHB by BGC-823 were similar.The absorption content increased rapidly in the first hour and the cells reached platform after 4 hours' incubation.Within the concentration range of this experiment,the cell uptake of PENSHB and DPROHB rose with the incubating concentration,revealing a linear relationship and similar rising trend.The content of PENSHB and DPROHB in BGC-823 was dose-dependent and time-dependent. Conclusions Besides better water solubility and photodynamic effects,the two novel hypocrellin derivatives,namely,PENSHB and DPROHB,perform well in cell absorption.They are new photosensitizers with the potential for clinical application.

lhz98Gm7.title: A novel medical robot assisting photodynamic therapy for port wine stains
lhz98Gm7.abstract: Port wine stain (PWS) birthmarks are congenital vascular malformations, which usually appear at birth and tend to become darker and thicker with age's growth. Vascular-targeted photodynamic therapy (PDT) is an effective approach in the treatment of PWS. However, due to the arbitrariness of manual operation and pole points existing in laser radiation, the PWS zone was always cured unevenly in clinics. So we developed a novel robotic system which consists of a passive arm and an active wrist, to assist doctors in exerting PDT treatments. The passive joints are easy to interaction with doctors, safer and more convenience; the active joints can automate the PDT so that the doctors can focus more on clinical judgements and treatments rather than heave manual works. In this paper, the mechanism of PWS and its treatments were described in brief, and then the robotic system including the detailed robot mechanical design and kinematic analysis was discussed based on the requirements of PDT. Finally, the robot feasibility was validated by experimental results. © 2010 IEEE.

lrqvL81M.title: Effects of activated state of T cells from human peripheral blood on absorption of photosensitizer hematoporphyrin monomerthyl ether
lrqvL81M.abstract: AIM: To investigate the characterization of absorption of hematoporphyrin monomerthyl ether (HMME), a domestic new generation photosensitizer product, by activated T cells from human peripheral blood. METHODS: Evaluation was performed by flow cytometry on the effects of incubating concentration and time of HMME on absorption by activated T cells. Lymphocytes were separated from human peripheral blood by density gradient centrifugation with Ficoll and T cells were activated with polyclonal stimulators PHA and PDB+Ion. To analyze the effects of HMME incubating doses on the absorption of activated T cells, the cultural lymphocytes were incubated with a serial doses of HMME for 1 h and HMME absorption were measured by FACS after immuno-staining with anti-CD3 antibody. To test the impact of HMME incubating time on the absorption of activated T cells, the cultural lymphocytes were incubated with HMME for various times and HMME absorption were measured by FACS after immuno-staining with anti-CD3 antibody. RESULTS: The HMME absorption-dose curve and absorption-time curve were shifted to right and up in the activated T cells as compared to resting T cells. HMME absorptions of activated T cells were statistic significantly larger than that of resting T cells in the doses between 5 mg/L to 20 mg/L. HMME absorptions of either activated T cells or resting T cells underwent a gradual increase with the incubation-time in HMME at concentration of 10 mg/L. HMME absorptions of activated T cells were statistic significantly larger than that of resting T cells in the incubation-time between 15 to 60 min. CONCLUSION: The differences of HMME absorption between activated T cells and resting T cells depend on the incubation times and doses of HMME. HMME absorption of activated T cells are significantly larger than that of resting T cells in certain incubation-times and doses. These results suggest that incubation time and dose associated with HMME-PDT therapeutic windows will be created for selective deletion of activated T cells.

mZYkYqVA.title: Contrast study on the subcellular localization of photosensitizers by quantitative analysis and image observation method
mZYkYqVA.abstract: Objective To compare and evaluate the application value of quantitative analysis and image observation method in determining the subcellular localization of photosensitizers. Methods A549 lung cancer cells were incubated with HMME for 2,12 and 24 h.Four subcellular organelles were labeled by fluorescent probes,and the fluorescence images of HMME and probes were detected using the inverted fluorescence microscope and cooled CCD.IB/IA was calculated quantitatively,which represents the ratio of HMME fluore-scence intensity in region with high probe fluorescence intensity and in the cell. Results The images showed that,at three incubation times,HMME in both kinds of cells had diffuse distribution in cytoplasm and organelles,with little nuclear stain.The quantitative results showed that arranged in descending order of IB/IA in A549 lung cancer cells at 2 h,they were Golgi,lysosome,mitochondria,and ER in turn.At 12 h,IB/IA was detected from high to low in Golgi,lysosome,ER and mitochondria.At 24 h,IB/IA decreased in Golgi,ER,lysosome,and mitochondria in turn.The IB/IA in Golgi increased with incubation time. Conclusion The characteristics of intracellular distribution of HMME along with incubating time can be more accurately embodied by quantitative analysis than by image observation method.

SoL8UnV3.title: An Intravital Microscopic Observation Method for PDT Research:Its Establishment and Evaluation
SoL8UnV3.abstract: Objective To establish and evuluation a scientific method to observe PDT effects on rat microcirculation.Methods The rat mesenteric microcirculation model was used in this study.The classic microcirculation method using intravital microscopy was improved in order to meet the especial request of this experiment.A 532nm KTP laser with a fiberoptic light delivery system was used to illuminate a 0.6cm diameter spot centered in the rat mesentery and the power density of light was measured by a thermopile.The changes of the blank control group,the only laser group,the only photosensitizer(HpD) group,and the photodynamic therapy with photosensitizer hematoporphyrin derivative(HpD) group were obseverd.The RBC cells column diameter(RBCCD),blood flow velocity(BFV) and blood flow states(BFS) in microvasculature were measured to estimate the stability of the methods.ResultsThe use of the improved intravital microscopy of mesenteric microcirculation allowed us to measure in detail the changes in small blood vessel during 120min and the microvasculature did not show any changes.There were no significant drops in the RBCCD,BFV and BFS(P>0.05).There were no obviously changes in the microcirculation of both the only light group and the only photosensitizer(HpD) group,however,in the PDT group,the remarkable injuries in the microcirculation were observed.ConclusionsThe improved technique to observe PDT effects on microcirculation is able to maintain the normal microvascular structure and function in an enough long time and meet the requests of PDT research.

2VQnWUuD.title: Absorption Characteristics of Hypertrophic Scar Fibroblast on HMME and Inhibitory Effect of HMME-PDT
2VQnWUuD.abstract: Objective To investigate the absorption characteristics of hypertrophic scar fibroblast(HSF) on hematoporphyrin monomethyl ether(HMME) and the inhibitory effect of HMME-PDT. Methods Fibroblasts were cultured from nontreated burn hypertrophic scars,and the 4-6 passage cells were used in the experiments.HSF was incubated with HMME at different concentrations(0-40μg/ml) and different incubation time(0-120min).The absorption characteristics of HSF on HMME were detected by flow cytometry(FCM).Cell viability after HMME-PDT was detected by MTT assay. ResultsThe absorption of HMME by HSF was increased with increased concentration and incubation time.HMME-PDT inhibited the proliferation of HSF significantly.The growth curve was declined following the increased HMME concentration and light dose. ConclusionsIncubation concentration and time are two important factors for the absorption of HMME by HSF.HMME-PDT inhibits the proliferation of HSF which depending on HMME concentration and laser energy density.

KQqml6Qr.title: Interaction of HMME,HB and THB with Plasma,Serum and Serum Albumin
KQqml6Qr.abstract: Objective To detect the absorption and fluorescence spectroscopy of HMME,HB and THB in the presence of different blood fraction,and to investigate the main carrier of HMME,HB and THB in blood.Methods We chose human plasma,human blood serum,bovine blood serum and bovine serum albumin as the photosensitizer carriers,HMME,HB and THB interacted with the four media fully,and recorded the absorption and emission.ResultsThe interaction of HMME,HB and THB with human plasma,human blood serum,bovine blood serum and bovine serum albumin induced the modifications of absorption spectra and emission spectra.The red shift of HMME in absorption and emission peaks was obvious.But the red shift of HB and THB in absorption spectra was smaller,and new emission bands appeared.ConclusionsThe interaction rule of HMME,HB and THB with human plasma is almost same,and it is quite different from interactions with bovine blood serum and bovine serum albumin.HMME interacts with bovine serum albumin mainly;HB interacted not only with bovine serum albumin but also other components in blood;THB interacts with bovine serum albumin and forms new fluorescence from twisted intramolecular charge transfer state.

C4CICgTN.title: Photobleaching Reaction Kinetic Rules of HMME in Different Solutions
C4CICgTN.abstract: Objective To analyze the photobleaching reaction kinetic rules of hematoporphyrin monomethyl ether(HMME) in different solutions,in order to provide information for the study of mathematic model of HMME-PDT for port wine stains.Methods The photobleaching reaction kinetic rules of HMME in simple and complex solutions(containing photooxidizable substrates) were analyzed based on the reaction kinetic theory and the photochemical reactions of photobleaching.Then the photobleaching data of HMME(HMME concentration at different irradiation time) were collected by measuring the absorbance value at different time before and after laser irradiation.The photobleaching kinetic equations were checked by analyzing the photobleaching experiment results.Results The chemical reaction kinetic processes of HMME photobleaching followed a first order kinetic process in simple solutions(PBS,DMSO),and followed a second order kinetic process in complex solutions containing photooxidizable substrates(albumin solution,cells suspension).Conclusions The chemical reaction kinetic processes of HMME photobleaching differ in different solutions.It is feasible to analyze some complicated photochemical reactions such as photobleaching according to chemical reaction dynamic principle.And it makes the understanding of complicated reaction process an easy work.

Ia4sZENL.title: Research on Effects of 578.2 nm Laser on Retina Function
Ia4sZENL.abstract: Objective To observe functional changes to rabbits' retina by applying the 578.2 nm laser pulse with a pulsewidth of 20-40 ns on retinas of rabbit eyes with different power densities(low and high).Methods Altogether 12 eyes of 6 rabbits were divided into 3 groups(the normal,low dose,high dose groups) and exposed to the 578.2 nm laser with a spot size of 2 mm for 100 s.The retinas were checked with visual electrophysiology instruments a week later,and the judgment whether they were impaired functionally was made.Results As to the scotopia ERG,both the low dose group and high dose group differed from the normal group in Ab(uv).In regard to biggest electricity reaction of dark adaptation,both the low dose group and high dose group were different from the normal group in La(ms).Conclusions The electroretinogram showed that the retinas of the rabbits in the low dose group had changed functionally.

sh8SQQam.title: Hematoporphyrin Monomethyl Ether-mediated Photodynamic Therapy on Expression of Mice Skin Proteins:a Mass Spectometry Study
sh8SQQam.abstract: Objective To elucidate the specific biomarker of irradiated mice skin to hematoporphyrin monomethyl ether(HMME) mediated photodynamic therapy(HMME-PDT). Methods Female BALB/c mice were irradiated by 532 nm laser at power density of 50 mW/cm2 for 20 min after intravenous injection of 10 mg/kg HMME immediately. The irradiated skin tissue was harvested and then homogenized in lysis buffer, soluble protein was quantitated and used for surface-enhanced laser-desorption/ionization time-of-flight mass spectrometry(SELDI-TOF-MS). Results HMME-PDT could significantly affect the mass spectometry expression of irradiated mice skin, the intensity of 7 distinct proteins was found significantly changed compared with control. Among them, 2 proteins were up-regulated and 5 proteins were down-regulated in PDT group and 1 protein was down-regulated in light irradiated group. Conclusions Proteomic analysis of skin following PDT treatment or light irradiation results in significant changing the expression pattern of skin proteins, suggesting involvement of these proteins in the cutaneous response mechanism to PDT stress or temperature stress.

sEVLRFtC.title: Optimization of hypocrellin B derivative amphiphilicity and biological activity
sEVLRFtC.abstract:
To satisfy the dual requirements of the fluent transportation in blood and the affinity to the target tissues of vascular
 diseases, hypocrellin derivatives with optimized amphiphilicity are expected. In this work, 3-amino-1-propanesulfonic acid
 and 4-amino-1-butanesulfonic acid substituted hypocrellin B, named compounds 1 and 2, were designed, synthesized in high yields
 and characterized. Besides greatly strengthened red absorption, the maximum solubility of compound 2 in phosphate buffered
 saline (PBS) is 4.2 mg/mL which is just enough to prepare an aqueous solution for intravenous injection in clinically acceptable
 concentration, while the partition coefficient between n-octanol and PBS, 5.6, benefits the cell-uptake and biological activity
 as well. Furthermore, EPR measurements reveal that the photosensitization activities of the two compounds to generate semiquinone
 anion radicals, superoxide anion radicals and singlet oxygen are a little bit higher than those of taurine substituted hypocrellin
 B (THB), but the photodynamic activities to human lung cancer A549 cells are several times that of THB, mainly due to increases
 in lipophilicity and cell-uptake.
keywords: photodynamic therapy to vas capillary diseases

srkrE036.title: Photodynamic Activity and Security of Five New Hypocrellins Derivatives in Human Lung Cancer A549 Cells
srkrE036.abstract: Objective To study the photodynamic activity of five new hypocrellins derivatives in human lung cancer A549 cells line,filtrate these hypocrellin derivatives,discuss their metabolism and transport in vivo,and study the combination of hypocrellin derivative molecule with HSA for the sake of driving photosensitive drug development. Methods(1)Spectral properties of hypocrellin derivatives.The absorption spectra of THB,3HB,4HB,3SB,4SB and HB(8 M in PBS and 35 M in DMSO) were measured with UV-vis spectrophotometer respectively.The absorption and emission spectra of fluorescence of 4SB and HpD were measured in PBS or mixed 20 μM HSA in PBS.(2)Photodynamic activity of novel hypocrellin B derivatives in human lung cancer A549 cells.Treatment conditions,A549 cells were incubated with drug for 4 h.After the incubated cells were irradiated for 24 h,the cells survival was estimated.0.94 nM HB and its derivatives were irradiated with 630 nm and 532 nm laser of 20 mW/cm2 for 1 000 s,after which the cells survival was estimated.A549 cells were incubated with 3SB,4SB and HpD for 24 h and the IC50 of cytotoxin was calculated.3SB,4SB and HpD were irradiated with 532 nm laser and the IC50 was calculated.4SB and HpD were irradiated with 630 nm laser and the IC50 was calculated.A safety factor was used as the ratio of cytotoxic IC50 to phototoxic IC50 to compare the safety of hypocrellin derivatives and HpD under 532 nm and 630 nm irradiation. Results The cell-killing effects of 4SB were stronger than that of other HB derivatives under 630 nm or 532 nm laser irradiation.The dark-cytotoxin sequence was HpD>3SB>4SB(7.84,11.22 and 21.93 μg/ml),and the dark-cytotoxin of HpD was 2.79 times and 1.42 times higher than that of 4SB and 3SB.The photo-cytotoxin sequence was 4SB>3SB>HpD(103.86、84.16、960.14 ng/ml).The photo-cytotoxin of 3SB and 4SB was 10.53 and 11.4 times higher than that of HpD respectively under 532 nm laser irradiation(P>0.05).The Photo-cytotoxin of 4SB(50.7 ng/ml) was 21.2 times than that of HpD(1 069.88) under 630 nm laser irradiation(P<0.05).The safety factor sequence was 4SB(260.6)>3SB(108)>HpD(8.2) under 532 nm laser irradiation and was 4SB(432.5)>HpD(7.3) under 630 nm laser irradiation.Opposite to that of 4SB(P<0.05),the difference between the safety factors of HpD under 532 nm and 630 nm laser is not statistically significant(P>0.05). Conclusions Having the potential to become valuable photosensitizers,the five hypocrellin derivatives are worth further study.

FXg49JQO.title: Retinal injury threshold of 532nm laser exposure
FXg49JQO.abstract: Objectives:To establish the retinal injury threshold of 532nm laser exposure to rabbit.Methods:Twenty-eight eyes of fourteen New Zealand albino rabbits exposed to a frequency-doubled Nd:YAG laser(532 nm) coupled to a slit lamp biomicroscope using a spot size of 2mm.The power density ranged from 900 to 1500 mW/cm2 with exposure time of 100 seconds.The damage incidence rate of retina was evaluated at 24 hour after irradiation.The ED50 was calculated with probit analysis method.Results: The ED50 for 532nm laser exposure to the rabbit retina was 119.7J/cm2.The 95% confidence interval was 112.6 J/cm2,127.0 J/cm2) and the probit slope S was 1.18.Conclusions: The retinal injury threshold of rabbits exposed to 532 nm laser is 119.7J/cm2.

B6EzbnTv.title: Synthesis and Photodynamic Action of Diphenyl-2,3-dihydroxychlorin: a Potential Tumor Photosensitizer
B6EzbnTv.abstract: The synthesis, photophysical properties of diphenyl-2,3-dihydroxychlorin (DPCOH) and its photocytotoxicity to tumor cells are described. DPCOH exhibits photodynamic activity in terms of type I and type II mechanisms under irradiation. The quantum yield of (1)O(2) in CHCl(3) is 0.7. For the photocytotoxicity to tumor cells, DPCOH proved to be 200 times more potent than HPD, and the dark toxicity is low (dark IC(90)>32 microg/mL).

F2DIpN7T.title: Rat Ear Blood Vessels Imaging by Optical Coherence Tomography
F2DIpN7T.abstract: Objective To develop a fiber optical coherence tomography(OCT) system in the utility of microvascular desease.Methods Choosing rat ear blood vessels as the model of PWS,we have studied the rat skin by OCT system,which established in our lab.Results Contrasting with the pathological section images,our OCT system could clearly distinguish the blood vessels from other tissues and get the diameter and depth of blood vessels.Conclusions We got conclusion that OCT technology is a promising scientific tool which may help to make diagnostic decisions on skin hemangiomas,such as PWS.

S99LQ3Az.title: The Spectral Property of 4SB and Interaction between 4SB and HSA
S99LQ3Az.abstract: Objective To study the spectral property of 17-4-amino-1-butane-sulfonic acid-hypocrellin B(4SB) and interaction between 4SB and human serum albumin(HSA).Methods The absorption spectra and fluorescence spectra of 4SB at different times after mixture 4SB with HSA for observing the influ-ence of interaction time.For observing the influence of HSA on the absorption spectra and fluorescence spectra of 4SB,measured the spectra of 5 μM/ml 4SB interacting with difference concentration of 0,1.25,2.5,5,10,and 20 μM/ml HSA.For observing the fluorescence quenching between 4SB and HSA,measured the fluorescence of 4SB and HAS after mixing 10 μM/ml HSA with difference concentration of 4SB.Results The value of absorption of 4SB was higher than that of HpD at the range above 600 nm,and the peak moved to red range and increased 2.3 times when mixed with HSA.The time of completely reaction between 4SB and HSA was 30 min.The ratio of 4SB binding with HSA was 1:1,and binding site was near the tryptophan residues.Conclusions 4SB is a potential photosensitizer because its good absorption in red range which enhanced by binding with HSA in the ratio of 1:1.
S99LQ3Az.venue: Chinese Journal of Laser Medicine & Surgery

oS3Pywm0.title: Apoptotic and Necrotic Cell Death Studies of Hypocrellins for Photodynamic Therapy
oS3Pywm0.abstract: Hypocrellins have gained considerable attention because of their light-induced antitumor and antiviral activities,they have been successfully employed in the photodynamic therapy(PDT) treatment of certain skin diseases and other diseases.The mechanisms of target cell death induced by hypocrellins-PDT were mainly through necrosis and apoptosis.In this paper,we summarized a series of function-group modified hypocrellin and their efficiency in the generation of reactive oxygen species,such as 1O2,O2-·and OH·,and the ability of their photodynamic properties.On the other hand,we summarized their influences on the mechanisms of cell necrosis and apoptosis induced by structure modification in the process of hypocrellins-PDT.

JKCgdyOW.title: Integrative Minitraumatic Valve Reparation with Endovascular Laser Coagulation in Patients with Primary Deep Venous Insufficiency:a 10 year Retrospective Clinical Research
JKCgdyOW.abstract: Objective To summarize the experience of an integrative minitraumatic valve reparation with endovascular laser coagulation in patients with primary deep venous insufficiency,and to investigate its methodology,effects,long-term results. Methods The first pair of superficial femoral venous valve was repaired with minimal incision and the varicose veins were coagulated with endovascular laser under epidural anesthesia.The 1 146 cases were followed with Doppler ultrasound from 2000 to 2011 years,and the cure rates and adverse effects were observed each year. Results All patients were cured when discharged from hospital,and their cure results were followed.The post-operative cure rates from six months and 1 to 10 years were 97.96%,97.95%,96.01%,95.60%,95.55%,95.37%,95.01%,94.43%,93.39%,89.02% and 88.42%,respectively. Conclusions The integration of laser photocoagulation with valve repair operations is one kind of convenient,minitraumatic,aesthetic and quick restorative therapeutic method to treat patients with primary deep venous valve insufficiency,and has a good long-term effect.It is deserved to be used widely in the future.

QPgOcXcT.title: Influence of drug-light-interval on photodynamic therapy of port wine stains--simulation and validation of mathematic models.
QPgOcXcT.abstract: We established mathematical models of photodynamic therapy (PDT) on port wine stains (PWS) to observe the effect of drug-light-interval (DLI) and optimize light dose.The mathematical simulations included determining (1) the distribution of laser light by Monte Carlo model, (2) the change of photosensitizer concentration in PWS vessels by a pharmacokinetics equation, (3) the change of photosensitizer distribution in tissue outside the vessels by a diffuse equation and photobleaching equation, and (4) the change of tissue oxygen concentration by the Fick's law with a consideration of the oxygen consumption during PDT. The concentration of singlet oxygen in the tissue model was calculated by the finite difference method. To validate those models, a PWS lesion of the same patient was divided into two areas and subjected to different DLIs and treated with different energy density. The color of lesion was assessed 8-12 weeks later.The simulation indicated the singlet oxygen concentration of the second treatment area (DLI=40 min) was lower than that of the first treatment area (DLI=0 min). However, it would be increased to a level similar to that of the first treatment area if the light irradiation time of the second treatment area was prolonged from 40 min to 55 min. Clinical results were consistent with the results predicted by the mathematical models.The mathematical models established in this study are helpful to optimize clinical protocol.

ujHKpL1d.title: Long-term Effect of Combination of Endovascular Laser Coagulation with Valve Reparation in Patients with Primary Deep Venous Valve Insufficiency
ujHKpL1d.abstract: Objective To investigate the middle and long-term effects of combination of endovascular laser coagulation with valve reparation of in patients with primary deep venous valve insufficiency.Methods The first pair of superficial femoral venous valve was repaired and the varicose veins were coagulated with endovascular laser under epidural anesthesia among 376 cases who were followed up more than 5 years,and the clinical cure rates and adverse effects were observed and analyzed each year.Results All patients were cured when discharged from hospital,and whose cure results were followed up more than 5 years.The clinical cure rates of 1 to 8 years post operation were 96.85%,95.64%,95.64%,95.40%,95.40%,95.05%,94.52% and 93.68%,respectively.Conclusions The combination of laser photocoagulation with valve repair operations is one kind of convenient,minitraumatic,aesthetic and quick restorative therapeutic methods to treat patients with primary deep venous valve insufficiency,and which have a good middle and long-term effects.It is deserved to be used widely in the future.

rYll2aJ4.title: Damage Effect of 578.2 nm Laser on Rabbit Retina
rYll2aJ4.abstract: To observe damage effect of 578.2 nm laser on rabbit retina,ten eyes of five New Zealand albino rabbits were exposed to a copper vapour laser(578.2 nm)coupled to a slit lamp biomicroscope using a spot size of 2 mm.The irradiation dose included 60 J/cm2,80 J/cm2,100 J/cm2,120 J/cm2,160 J/cm2 and 200 J/cm2 with exposure time of 100 seconds.The fundus photograph and light microscopic examination were performed at 1 hour and 24 hour after laser irradiation.Retinal damage induced by laser was strongly influenced by laser power density.With increasing of the power density,retinal damage aggravated.The retinal damage showed more severity at 24 h after irradiation than 1 h.When the laser power dose was 80 J/cm2 or 60 J/cm2,there were no obvious changes in retina.The main histopathological change located in rabbit choroid.In conclusion,the laser irradiation dose should be controlled less than 80 J/cm2 when 578.2 nm laser is used as light source of photodynamic therapy on fundus diseases.

NSCD4Uyd.title: Effect of HMME-PDT on Hypertrophic Scar Fibroblasts in Rabbit Ear Model
NSCD4Uyd.abstract: Objective To investigate the effect of hematoporphyrin monomethyl ether-photodynamic therapy(HMME-PDT)on hypertrophic scar fibroblasts(HSF)in the rabbit ear. Methods The acute model of dermal hypertrophic scar in the rabbit ear was established.Twenty four scar wounds were randomly di- vided into HMME-PDT treatment group and control group(n=12).Specimens were harvested from scar wounds on postoperative day 28.The mean AgNORs count of dermal fibroblastic cells in each tissue was determined through standard silver-staining method.Mean- while,HSF was observed by transmission electron microscopy(TEM). Results In control group,the mean AgNORs count of dermal fibroblasts was 3.01±0.64,whereas PDT group had mean AgNORs count of 1.87±0.72,respectively.Mitochondria,rough ER and Golgi of HSF revealed abundant in control group,while decreased and destroyed by PDT.Some fibroblasts underwent marked apoptosis after HMME-PDT. Conclusions HMME-PDT seemed to have good potent effects to inhibit HSF's proliferation,and collagen's synthesis.

7sZ20GjP.title: Photobleaching of Subcellular Distributed Sites of Photosensitizers:an Experimental Study
7sZ20GjP.abstract: Objective To discuss the characters of photobleaching of subcellular sites of photosensitizers distributed in targeted cells.Methods ECV304 Cells were subcultured and incubated with hematoporphyrin monomethyl ether(HMME) for 12 hours.Labeling technology of fluorescence probes and organelle-cell fluorescence intensity ratio analysis were adopted to study subcellular localization of HMME.Mercury lamp of fluorescence microscope was used as light source to have photosensitizers excitated and produce photodynamic effects.Fluorescence probe of ROS H2DCF-DA was used to detect production of singlet oxygen.Fluorescence images of four organelles and DCF were recorded respectively before and after irradiation.Results Fluorescence intensity of the whole cell after irradiation was decreased by 26.4%.According to every organelles, the average fluorescence intensity ratio of the mitochondria, lysosome, ER and Golgi were decreased by 31.1%, 23.4%,5.8% and 5.0% after irradiation separately.Enhancing fluorescence of DCF was detected in mitochondria with HMME or after irradiation.Conclusions Photodynamic effects may induce various quantity of singlet oxygen in various organelles and bring various degree of photobleaching.The speed of photobleaching of HMME in mitochondria is faster than others; more singlet oxygen is produced in mitochondria, which maybe one of primary targets of photodynamic therapy.

snG1pTE1.title: Hematoporphyrin monomethyl ether photodynamic damage on HeLa cells by means of reactive oxygen species production and cytosolic free calcium concentration elevation.
snG1pTE1.abstract: Hematoporphyrin monomethyl ether (HMME) is a novel and promising porphyrin-related photosensitizer for photodynamic therapy (PDT). HMME-PDT-induced cell death and its mechanisms were investigated in HeLa cells. We demonstrated that HMME-PDT could induce cell death through both necrosis and apoptosis. Sodium azide (the singlet oxygen quencher) or D-mannitol (the hydroxyl radical scavenger) could protect HeLa cells from the apoptosis and necrosis induced by HMME-PDT, showing that reactive oxygen species (ROS), such as singlet oxygen and hydroxyl radical, played a decisive role in HMME-PDT-induced HeLa cells death. Sodium azide or D-mannitol also inhibited HMME-PDT-mediated [Ca2+]i elevation. Cytochrome C (Cyto C) release from mitochondria into cytosol and Caspase-3 activation after HMME-PDT were inhibited by BAPTA/AM (an intracellular calcium chelator). These results demonstrated that ROS generated in HeLa cells by HMME-PDT-induced apoptosis may be through [Ca2+]i elevation which mediates Cyto C release and Caspase-3 activition and initiates the subsequent late stages of apoptosis.

zVi413NK.title: Photobleaching of Hematoporphyrin Monomethyl Ether in Normal Saline Solution
zVi413NK.abstract: Objective To establish a fluorescence spectroscopy system and to investigate the phenomena of photobleaching during photodynamic reaction induced by hematoporphyrin monomethyl ether (HMME).Methods The photobleching process of HMME was monitored by optical multichannel analyzer. The concentration of HMME was 1 μg/ml and 10 μg/ml. 532 nm Laser was used both as light source for PDT and as excitation light source for HMME fluorescence. During the procedure of PDT, the fluorescence spectrum of the sample was collected, stored in the computer and processed for results.Results The photobleaching process at high concentration was more rapidly than that at low concentration. A new fluorescence peak emerged at 639 nm during the photobleaching process of HMME. According to the variation of the background fluorescence, the photobleaching process could be divided into two stages: (1)in the early stage of laser irradiation,the fluorescence intensity at 613 nm and 674 nm decreased with the prolonging of time, and the fluorescence intensity at 639 nm increased.(2)In the later stage, all the three fluorescence peaks decreased, but the self-background fluorescence increased very quickly, and the intensity at the end of irradiation was 1.45 times of the initial intensity.Conclusions The photobleaching of HMME is a very complicated process, and can be affected by the initial concentration of HMME with generation of photoproduct during this process, and with rebleaching phenomena.

kzLwAMgf.title: Relationship between the blood perfusion values determined by laser speckle imaging and laser Doppler imaging in normal skin and port wine stains.
kzLwAMgf.abstract: Laser Doppler imaging (LDI) and laser speckle imaging (LSI) are two major optical techniques aiming at non-invasively imaging the skin blood perfusion. However, the relationship between perfusion values determined by LDI and LSI has not been fully explored.8 healthy volunteers and 13 PWS patients were recruited. The perfusions in normal skin on the forearm of 8 healthy volunteers were simultaneously measured by both LDI and LSI during post-occlusive reactive hyperemia (PORH). Furthermore, the perfusions of port wine stains (PWS) lesions and contralateral normal skin of 10 PWS patients were also determined. In addition, the perfusions for PWS lesions from 3 PWS patients were successively monitored at 0, 10 and 20 mins during vascular-targeted photodynamic therapy (V-PDT). The average perfusion values determined by LSI were compared with those of LDI for each subject.In the normal skin during PORH, power function provided better fits of perfusion values than linear function: powers for individual subjects go from 1.312 to 1.942 (R(2)=0.8967-0.9951). There was a linear relationship between perfusion values determined by LDI and LSI in PWS and contralateral normal skin (R(2)=0.7308-0.9623), and in PWS during V-PDT (R(2)=0.8037-0.9968).The perfusion values determined by LDI and LSI correlate closely in normal skin and PWS over a broad range of skin perfusion. However, it still suggests that perfusion range and characteristics of the measured skin should be carefully considered if LDI and LSI measures are compared.

z8om93qZ.title: Short-Term Efficacy of Vascular Targeted Photodynamic Therapy for Gastric Antral Vascular Ectasia
z8om93qZ.abstract: Objective To explore the possibility of vascular targeted photodynamic therapy(V-PDT) for gastric antral vascular ectasia(GAVE) treatment. Methods Immediately after intravenous injection of PSD-007 at 5 mg/kg body weight,the patients with GAVE were irradiated with 630 nm semiconductor laser at power density of 80-100 mW/cm.At first,a cylindrical fiber was used to irradiation for 20 minutes, then a point-like optical fiber was used for 10 minutes.The total energy density was 144-180 J/cm.Endoscopy examination was conducted to evaluate the short-term at 5 weeks after effect PDT. Immediately after V-PDT,endoscopic examination revealed the expanded capillary significantly darkened the color and stopped the bleeding,and gastric mucosa edema became more marked.Four days after V-PDT,black stool disappeared and occult test was negative.Endoscopic examination at 1 week after V-PDT showed abnormal expansion of capillaries of proximal gastic antrum almost disappeared,remote gastric antrum seen superficial ulcer formation.Anemia of the patients was significantly improved at 5 weeks after V-PDT.Endoscopic examination revealed abnormal expansion of capillaries of proximal gastric antrum almost disappeared.No adverse events were seen during and after PDT. Conclusions The preliminary study showed V-PDT could selectively destroyed the abnormal expanded capillaries of GAVE with rapid effect and suggesting V-PDT be an safe and effective treatment for GAVE.But it will take a large sample,prospecitve stuidies to further validate the feasibility.
