LSFBBhY7.title: Hypocrellin B Concentration Monitoring in vitro in Photodynamic Therapy
LSFBBhY7.abstract: Objective To detect the hypocrellin B(HB) concentration in ECV304 cells and culture medium,and the photobleaching property in vitro.Methods ECV304 cells were incubated with HB(10 μg/ml or 30 μg/ml) for 2 h,at each concentration two groups(control group without laser irradiation and PDT group) were set.In the control group,after HB incubation,fluorescence image of HB was detected by fluorescence microscopy;HB in cells and RPMI medium 1 640 was extracted by ethyl acetate solution,then to record the absorption spectra and to calculate the concentration from a standard HB concentration curve.In the PDT group,after being exposed to 532 nm laser light,the concentration of HB was measured using the same method as in control group,and HB in cells and RPMI medium 1 640 was analyzed by HPLC.Results When the incubation concentrations were 10 or 30 μg/ml,the concentrations of HB in cells were not increased in proportion to incubation concentrations.After PDT,HB in culture medium and cells was bleached.Conclusions We can estimate the concentration of HB in vitro before and after PDT from a standard HB absorption-concentration curve.

kz44T2iY.title: Integration Valve Reparation under Small Incision with Endovascular Laser Coagulation for Primary Deep Venous Insufficiency——1146 Cases Report
kz44T2iY.abstract: Objective To summarize the clinical experiences of combination methods of mini-traumatic reparation of valve function with small incision in femoral part and intravenous laser photocoagulation in the varicose veins for primary deep venous valve dysfunction of lower limbs.Methods Data of 1 278 affected limbs in 1 146 patients with primary deep venous valve dysfunction were retrospectively analyzed.The procedures were performed under epidural anesthesia.The first pair of valve of femoral superficial vein was repaired with 4 cm incision,and then the dilated varicose veins were obliterated by intravenous laser photocoagulation with 810 nm wavelength laser semiconductor.Results At the same day on the operation,the patients could get off the bed with no complication.All the cases were followed up for 3.0 years meanly,and the 1-,2-,3-,4-,5-,6-,7-,8-year clinical recovery rate was 96.95%,96.06%,95.60%,95.51%,95.40%,95.05%,94.52%,93.68% respectively.Conclusions The integration of laser photocoagulation with small incision valve repair is one kind of convenient,mini-traumatic,aesthetic and quick restorative therapeutic method for patients suffered from primary deep venous valve with a good middle and long-term effects.It is deserved to be used widely in the future.

OHxvp4hc.title: Impact of Laser Power Density on Retinal and Choroidal Biological Effect During HMME-PDT
OHxvp4hc.abstract: Objective To observe the biological impact on the normal retina and choroid irradiated by the same energy fluence with different power density and irradiation duration during hematoporphyrin monomethyl ether(HMME) photodynamic therapy(PDT). Methods The fundi of the New Zealand rabbits were irradiated by 532nm laser with a fluence of 20J/cm~2 within 5 minutes after the HMME intravenous injection of 5mg/kg body weight. The power density was 100, 200, 300 and 400mW/cm~2and duration was 200, 100, 66 and 50 seconds,respectively. The biological effect on the retina and choroid was examined by fundus photography and fluorescein angiography at 6h, 12h, 1d, 3d and 5 d after HMME-PDT. The treated area was resected to perform histological examination when the choriocapillaris occlusion could be identified in fluorescein angiography. Results The selective occlusion of choriocapillaris could be observed at the 5th day after PDT with power density 100 mW/cm~2 and at the 3rd day with 200mW/cm~2 without injury to the surrounding normal retina. The nonselective damage to the retina could be seen at 1st day with 300 mW/cm~2 which could recover at the 3rd day and the choriocapillaris was found to be closed simultaneously. The retinal damage appeared earlier at the 6th hour after PDT with 400mW/cm~2and recovered at the 5th day, meanwhile the occlusion of choriocapillaris and some big choroidal vessels were seen clearly. Conclusions The key factor which determined the photodynamic effect is the power density. The higher the power density is, the earlier the biological effect can be seen and the much more probability of the injury to the surrounding normal retina and big choroidal vessels will happen.

TCNSLJdV.title: Retinal Injury Thresholds due to Copper Vapor Laser with Wavelength of 578.2 nm
TCNSLJdV.abstract: Objective To determine the lesion thresholds of 578.2 nm laser pulses with pulsewidths of 20-40 ns on the retinas of live rabbit eyes and to inquire into the elements which influence the laser biological effect.Methods Thirty eyes of 15 rabbits were exposed to the laser with wavelengths of 578.2 nm.The exposed animals were divided into six groups[total intraocular power(TIP)=15,30,45,60,75 and 90 mW].The duration was 100 s,and the spot size was 2 mm.The au-thors examined and scored all laser impact sites in the retina ophthalmoscopically with fundus photography and fluorescein angiography to identify evidence of visible laser lesion at1 h and 24 h after exposure.To calculate the retinal injury thresholds,50% minimum visi-ble lesion probability(MVLED50)and 50% fluorescein angiography visible lesion probabith(FAVLED50).ResultsThe copper vapor laser with wavelength of578.2 nm was irradiated at the condition of exposure time of100 s and retinal laser spots diameter of 2 mm.The MVLED50at 1 h was TIP =69.24 mW with the power density at the retina =1 805.97 mW/cm2,and the MVLED50at 24 h was TIP =53.25 mW,and the power density at the retina =1 388.92 mW/cm2,the FAVLED50at 24 h was TIP = 51.62 mW,with the power density at the retina =1 346.26 mW/cm2.ConclusionsAt the same exposure time and the same light spot diameter,TIP is the most important element to determine the laser retinal biology effect.In the 24 hours after exposure,as the time past,the retinal injury is aggravating.

9flaSjTq.title: Effects of photodynamic therapy on injured skeletal muscles under different administration condition
9flaSjTq.abstract: Aim: To establish the photodynamic therapy (PDT) plan of cardiac tumor by setting up the perfusion model of rabbit skeletal muscles and observing photodynamic effects on injured skeletal muscles under different administration. Methods: The experiment was performed at the laboratory of the Department of Laser Medicine, General Hospital of Chinese PLA from January to June 2004. A rabbit limb local perfusion model was established. The photosensitizer PSD-007 concentration of local perfusion group was 120 and 240 mg/L, the general perfusion group was administrated with PSD-007(5 mg/kg) intravenously and the control group was only given laser illumination. 632. 8 nm and 532 nm lasers were selected and the irradiation dose was 180 J/cm2. Gross changes were colleted by digital camera, and the morphohistological changes were observed under light microscope immediately and at 3 days after laser irradiation. Results: There was no obvious alteration in skeletal muscles of local perfusion group immediately after laser irradiation, and showed mild or medium-grade damage in a dot- and snip-shaped necrosis at 3 days. The extent of injury in the groups irradiated by 532 nm laser was serious than that in those groups irradiated by 632. 8 nm laser, while the photosensitizer at different concentration played a little role in the injury degree of PDT. All rabbits of general perfusion group showed severe red damage at the irradiated location immediately after irradiation, the irradiated parts by two wavelength lasers showed porcelain-white coagulation necrosis morphologically and histologically at 3 days after irradiation, and the irradiated region with wine necrosis around was severely damaged. While, the control group was not damaged morphologically or under light microscope immediately and 3 days after irradiation. Conclusion: This model may effectually simulate PDT of myocardial tumor after perfusion when the heart beating quitted under systemic circulation. Local perfusion can weaken photodynamic effects after pulse beating stopped, and hypoxia is the most important factor restricting photodynamic effects in such a model.

UDqZwG5j.title: Simulations and experiments about the influence of HMME concentration in blood vessel during a short time on photodynamic therapy microvascular effect
UDqZwG5j.abstract: Objective Study the influence of Hematoporphyrin Monomethyl Ether (HMME) concentration in blood vessel in a rather short time on photodynamic therapy (PDT) microvascular effect by mathematical modeling and animal experiment. Methods The yields of singlet oxygen in blood vessel in a short time in different animal were simulated by mathematical model, and the yields of singlet oxygen in Leghorn Cocks vessel were simulated when the irradiation time was 20 min with 5 min and 60 min drug-light interval separately. 0.2 ml blood was gotten at 0, 5, 15, 10, 15, 20, 30, 50, 80 min after HMME (10 mg/Kg) was injected intravenously in Leghorn Cocks and was measured by fluorescence spectrophotometer for calculation of HMME concentration. Simultaneity, a square of cock comb (2×2 cm) was randomly irradiated (532nm, 100 mW/cm 2) at 5-25min and another one was irradiated at 60-80 min, and the change was observed by macroscopy and pathology. Results Simulations showed that the yield of singlet oxygen in vessels of different animals varied markedly in a short time and correlated with the concentration of photosensitizer in vessels. The produce of singlet oxygen in cock's blood vessel during 5-25 min PDT is 5.3 times more than that during 60~80 min PDT. Experiments showed that the red color of the square irradiationat 5-25 min was faded, but the color of the square irradiation at 60~80 min had no change. Conclusions The change of HMME concentration in blood vessel during a short time after intravenous injection have a big influence on the PDT microvascular effect. © 2007 IEEE.

b6UJSAC2.title: Clinical experience of photodynamic therapy in China
b6UJSAC2.abstract: PDT was introduced to China in the late of 1970s as an experimental treatment of cancer. During the past 26 years, thousands of patients with cancerous or non-cancerous diseases have been treated by PDT and a plenty of clinical experience has been gained, especially the advanced experience in the treatment of port-wine stains (PWS), nasopharyngeal carcinoma (NPC) and condyloma acuminatum. In the future, Chinese researchers will hopefully continue to try their best to get a better understanding about the mechanism of PDT and to optimize clinical application of PDT. © 2007 IEEE.

qNDYRbeZ.title: Choosing optimal wavelength for photodynamic therapy of port wine stains by mathematic simulation.
qNDYRbeZ.abstract: Many laser wavelengths have been used in photodynamic therapy (PDT) for port wine stains (PWS). However, how these wavelengths result in different PDT outcomes has not been clearly illuminated. This study is designed to analyze which wavelengths would be the most advantageous for use in PDT for PWS. The singlet oxygen yield in PDT-treated PWS skin under different wavelengths at the same photosensitizer dosage was simulated and the following three situations were simulated and compared: 1. PDT efficiency of 488, 532, 510, 578, and 630 nm laser irradiation at clinical dosage (100 mW∕cm(2), 40 min); 2. PDT efficiency of different wavelength for PWS with hyperpigmentation after previous PDT; 3. PDT efficiency of different wavelengths for PWS, in which only deeply located ectatic vessels remained. The results showed that singlet oxygen yield is the highest at 510 nm, it is similar at 532 nm and 488 nm, and very low at 578 nm and 630 nm. This result is identical to the state in clinic. According to this theoretical study, the optimal wavelength for PDT in the treatment of PWS should near the absorption peaks of photosensitizer and where absorption from native chromophores (haemoglobin and melanin) is diminished.

NIYvpzBW.title: Theoretical investigation of thermal retinal response to photodynamic therapy for choroidal neovascularization
NIYvpzBW.abstract: To study the risk of thermal injury in photodynamic therapy for choroidal neovascularization by calculating the retinal temperature of rabbits, a mathematical model for laser induced thermal effect on retina was developed. Homogeneous layer retinal models of different pigmented rabbits were presented to analyze the light distribution. The finite element method realized by Matlab software was used to solve classical bio-heat transfer model - Pennis equation, in which heat loss due to choroidal blood flow was considered. The retinal temperature was calculated with different laser parameters, including different wavelengths (532nm, 578nm and 690nm), power density (200-1600 mW/cm 2), spot diameter (1mm, 2mm and 3mm) and different pigmented eye fundi. The prediction results showed the retinal temperature increased first, then reached maximum in a few seconds and kept constant during laser irradiation. Once laser exposure ended, the temperature decreased quickly to normal. With the increase of laser power density and spot size, the retinal temperature raised too. The temperature reduced exponentially with the distance from laser spot increased. The maximum temperature of non-pigmented rabbits was lower than that of pigmented rabbits. The temperature induced by 578nm laser irradiation was highest, the next was by 532nm laser and the lowest was by 690nm laser. For current parameters used to treat choroidal neovascularization (690nm, 600mW, 2mm, 83 sec), the maximum retinal temperature calculated was less than 45°C, which indicating no thermal damage induced.

YO061QaK.title: SNR-adaptive OCT angiography enabled by statistical characterization of intensity and decorrelation with multi-variate time series model.
YO061QaK.abstract: In OCT angiography (OCTA), decorrelation computation has been widely used as a local motion index to identify dynamic flow from static tissues, but its dependence on SNR severely degrades the vascular visibility, particularly in low- SNR regions. To mathematically characterize the decorrelation-SNR dependence of OCT signals, we developed a multi-variate time series (MVTS) model. Based on the model, we derived a universal asymptotic linear relation of decorrelation to inverse SNR (iSNR), with the variance in static and noise regions determined by the average kernel size. Accordingly, with the population distribution of static and noise voxels being explicitly calculated in the iSNR and decorrelation (ID) space, a linear classifier is developed by removing static and noise voxels at all SNR, to generate a SNR-adaptive OCTA, termed as ID-OCTA. Then, flow phantom and human skin experiments were performed to validate the proposed ID-OCTA. Both qualitative and quantitative assessments demonstrated that ID-OCTA offers a superior visibility of blood vessels, particularly in the deep layer. Finally, implications of this work on both system design and hemodynamic quantification are further discussed.

89JIn8pQ.title: Clinical study of 1949 cases of port wine stains treated with vascular photodynamic therapy (Gu's PDT) | Analyse clinique de 1949 angiomes plans traités par thérapie photodynamique vasculaire (Gu's PDT)
89JIn8pQ.abstract: Background. Complete fading of port wine stains (PWS) is difficult to achieve with current laser treatments. Photodynamic therapy (Gu's PDT) could offer a very efficient alternative for PWS therapy. Patients and method. 1949 lesions in 1385 patients were treated by PDT. Each patient received an intravenous injection of hematoporphyrin derivative (HpD) or hematoporphyrin monomethyl ether (HMME) at 3-7 mg/kg. Laser irradiation was performed on a 2 to 8 cm spot size. Different wavelengths (488.0 nm to 578.2 nm) were evaluated with a power density of 50∼100 mW/cm 2. Fluences ranged from 90 to 540 J/cm 2. Results. Among the 1942 lesions, PWS clearance was observed in 99.7% of cases. Excellent results were achieved in 128 lesions (6.6%) (100 % clearance), 746 lesions (38.3%) yielded to good results (clearance > 75%), 923 lesions (47.4%) showed moderate results (clearance 50-75%), 145 lesions (7.4%) showed poor results (clearance < 50%) and in 7 lesions (0.3%) no visible change was observed. The pink port wine stains revealed better response to Gu's PDT with only one session. Conversely, purple stains in adult patients required 2 sessions or more. Conclusion. This new PDT technique is effective and highly selective, with almost no risk of scarring.

ZDe2evbR.title: Influence of light irradiation modalities on light distribution in human whole blood
ZDe2evbR.abstract: To compare the differences of the light distributions in blood with different light irradiation modalities, Monte Carlo simulation was applied. The light distribution of He-Ne laser (632.8nm) in human whole blood was simulated. The diameter of the optic fiber used was 400μm. We referred to the work done by other researchers to determine tissue optical parameters of blood. For the same output laser power of 5mW, our results showed that the highest power density could be more than 6000mW/cm2 using flat end optic fiber. But when using optical fiber coupled with cylindrical light diffuser (the length for light emission =3mm), the highest power density was less than 210mW/cm 2. Increasing the length of light emission could further reduce the highest power density. In summary, the optical fiber coupled with cylindrical light diffuser is a good modality for in vivo light irradiation in whole blood, which can decrease the light intensity and make it more uniformed distributed in blood. It is of great importance to choose the suitable light emission length of optic fiber coupled with cylindrical light diffuser for clinical applications. © 2010 Copyright SPIE - The International Society for Optical Engineering.

maTzTmGX.title: Light distribution in intravascular low level laser therapy applying mathematical simulation: a comparative study.
maTzTmGX.abstract: Intravascular low level laser therapy (ILLLT) has been applied in the treatment of many diseases for about twenty years. However, much fundamental work has not been done on its dosimetry. The study was designed to compare the difference of light distribution during ILLLT between using flat end fiber and optical fiber coupled with cylindrical light diffuser. Light distribution of He-Ne laser was processed by Monte Carlo model. The laser output was 5 mW. The diameter of both optical fibers was 400 microm. Four tissue optical parameters were chosen for simulation. The results showed that optical parameters of blood are important to determine the distribution of laser energy. The highest power density could increase to over 5000 mW/cm2 using flat end fiber. And the laser energy was absorbed by the blood cells in very small area before the tip of flat end fiber. But when using optical fiber coupled with cylindrical light diffuser, the highest power density was about 100 mW/cm2. More volume of blood cells could be irradiated by laser light. In summary, optical fiber coupled with cylindrical light diffuser is superior to flat end fiber at the aspect of increasing the volume of irradiated blood and decreasing unwanted damage to blood cells during intravascular low level laser therapy.

xHKwko7l.title: Assessment of the biological effect of hypocrellin B in photodynamic therapy system for retina and choroid
xHKwko7l.abstract: Background: Benzoporphyrin derivative monoacid A ring (BPD-MA), as the photosensitizer in photodynamic therapy (PDT) for senile macular degeneration (SMD), can not be widely accepted in China because of its higher price. The biological effect of domestic photosensitizer hypocrellin B (HB) PTD system on retina and choroid was accessed in our study, to explore the worthiness of further study on the prospect of HB in treating SMD. Objective: To introduce an experimental system to perform PDT irradiation system, the determination of the photosensitivity of the photosensitizers in vitro and evaluation of the therapeutic effect of photosensitizers for the retina and choroids in vivo. Design: An open trial. Setting, materials and intervention: The trial was conducted in the Department of Laser Medicine, General Hospital of Chinese PLA. Establishment of irradiation system: a laser window was created at the slit lamp microscope, which connected with 532 nm-laser in order to make the laser and the irradiation light of the slit lamp microscope to arrive at the fundus oculi at the same time. The photosensitivity of the photosensitizer was determined primarily by Methyl-thialolyl-tetrazolium (MTT) and compared with that of BPD-MA. Using chinchilla rabbits as subjects, the system was testified by domestic photosensitizer hypocrellin B photodynamic therapy (HB-PDT), whose biological effects at the irradiated area of rabbit were evaluated by fundus observation, fluorescein angiography and light and electron microscopy examination to investigate the feasibility and reliability of our experimental system. Main outcome measures: The coupling efficiency between slit lamp microscope and laser, in vitro photosensitivity of photosensitizer and their biological effects at the irradiated area. Results: The output of the laser was stable and the coupling efficiency between the laser and laser window of the slit lamp microscope was about 60%. The photosensitivity of HB in vitro was similar to BPD-MA, and HB-PDT displayed selective therapeutic property presented by closure of the retinal and choroidal capillaries with less damage to surrounding normal retina. Conclusion: It is useful to decide if a new photosensitizer fit for treating retinal and choroidal neovascularization by using the irradiation system and the method of determining the photosensitivity of the photosensitizer in vitro and biological effect in vivo.

DJ7BgJPH.title: Determination of Optical and Microvascular Parameters of Port Wine Stains Using Diffuse Reflectance Spectroscopy.
DJ7BgJPH.abstract: Characterizing port wine stains (PWS) with its optical parameters [i.e. absorption coefficient (μa) and reduced scattering coefficient (μs′)] and microvascular parameters [i.e. blood volume fraction (BVF), mean vessel diameter (MVD), and oxygen saturation (StO2)] is extremely important for elucidating the mechanisms for its light-based treatments, such as pulsed dye laser and photodynamic therapy. In this study, a customized diffuse reflectance spectroscopy (DRS) probe with an appropriate source-detector distance was used to measure the diffuse reflectance spectra of PWS lesions in clinical practice. The results demonstrate that optical parameters of different types of PWS lesions can be accurately extracted by fitting the DRS with diffusion equation. Since the sampling depth of the probe coincides with the depth distribution of abnormal vasculature in PWS, the obtained microvascular parameters of PWS lesions that changed from pink to purple are in agreement with the corresponding physiological conditions. This study suggests that DRS can be utilized to quantitatively determine the optical and microvascular parameters of PWS lesions, which have the potential for planning the protocol and predicting the efficiency for light-based PWS treatments.

HJRyRI1P.title: Influence of 510.6 nm Laser on Ultrastructure of Rabbit Vascular Smooth Muscle Cells
HJRyRI1P.abstract: Objective To observe the change in ultrastructure of vascular smooth muscle cells(VSMC)24 h after 510.6 nm laser irradiation on abdominal aorta of rabbits,and the relationship with light dose. Methods Twelve New Zealand rabbits'abdominal aortas were irradiated with the pillar optical fiber entered through femoral artery. There were 6 groups according to light dose:(1)100 mW/cm~2×500 s,(2)100 mW/cm~2×1000 s,(3)150 mW/cm~2×1 000 s,(4) 200 mW/cm~2×500 s,(5)200 mW/cm~2×1000 s,(6)control group.Rabbits were sacrificed 24 hours later,the morphological chan- ges in blood vessel tissues were observed by electron microscope. Results Apoptosis was observed in VSMC in the groups with 100 mW/cm~2 and 150 mW/cm~2 power density,and the damage was mainly in mitochondria.Necrosis was the main appearance in VSMC in the groups with 200 mW/cm~2. Conclusions 510.6 nm laser irradiation can induce VSMC on abdominal aorta of rabbits apoptosis 24 h later at power density of 100 mW/cm~2 or 150 mW/cm~2.

UyDeQfTa.title: Treatment of Osteoporosis, with a Focus on 2 Monoclonal Antibodies.
UyDeQfTa.abstract: Osteoporosis is a common skeletal disease characterized by bone loss and subsequent increased risk of fragility fractures. Recent advances in our mechanistic understanding of molecular communications among osteoblasts, osteoclasts, and osteocytes give insight into the important roles of the canonical Wnt/β-catenin pathway and the RANK/RANKL/OPG pathway in the process of bone remodeling. Due to the translation of the canonical Wnt/β-catenin pathway and the RANK/RANKL/OPG pathway in the regulation of osteoblasts and osteoclasts, new targets have been studied in recent years, such as sclerostin and receptor activator of NF-κB ligand (RANKL). In this review, we first introduce the signaling pathways involved in interactions among osteoblasts, osteoclasts, and osteocytes. Next, we describe clinical trials of denosumab and romosozumab, which are monoclonal antibodies that target RANKL and sclerostin, respectively. We analyze the efficacy of these drugs and provide a profile for the management of osteoporosis.

T5wxyJBl.title: Noninvasive and high-resolving photoacoustic dermoscopy of human skin.
T5wxyJBl.abstract: We proposed and developed a photoacoustic (PA) dermoscope equipped with an integrated PA probe to achieve quantification and high-resolution, high-contrast deep imaging of human skin. The PA probe, with light-sound confocal excitation and reception, is specially designed, and integrated with an objective lens, an ultrasound transducer, and an inverted-triangle coupling cup to facilitate convenient implementation in a clinical setting. The PA dermoscope was utilized for noninvasive and high-resolution imaging of epidermal and dermal structure in volunteers. The imaging results demonstrated that the characteristic parameters of skin disease, including pigment distribution and thickness, vascular diameter, and depth, can be obtained by the PA dermoscope, confirming that PA dermoscopy can serve as a potential tool for the diagnosis and curative effect evaluation of human skin disease.

vAFEG37D.title: The Investigation of Cytochrome C in HSF after HMME-PDT
vAFEG37D.abstract: Objective To observe the effect of HMME-PDT on the expression of Cytochrome C in human hypertrophic scar fibroblast (HSF). Methods Fibroblasts were cultured from untreated burn hypertrophic scars, and the cells of the 4th-6th generations were used in the experiment. Having grown to the level of 80% confluence, the fibroblasts were divided into 2 groups: the control (untreated) group and HMME-PDT group. For the HMME-PDT group, the medium was removed, serum-free medium with 4 μg/ml HMME was added, and the cells were given HMME for 4 h. The cells were then irradiated with 630 nm light produced by a diode laser (630 nm) at a power of 10 mW/cm2 (fluence: 2.5 J/cm2). Immunofluorescence staining method was applied for the observation of Cyc expression in HSF with fluorescence microscope. The apoptotic rate of the cells was detected with FCM after popodium iodide (PI) staining. Results Being almost negative in the control group, the Cyc-FITC staining result was highly enhanced in the HMME-PDT group. The detection results of FCM indicated that the apoptotic rate grew significantly after the HMME-PDT (30.54±3.78% VS 2.45±0.22%,P<0.05). Conclusions The mitochondria dysfunction caused by PDT may play a major role in leading the apoptosis of hypertrophic scar cells.

amVYz2iu.title: Inhibitory Effect of HMME-mediated Photodynamic Therapy on Proliferation of Human Keratinocyte in vitro
amVYz2iu.abstract: Objective To investigate the absorption characteristics of HMME and inhibitory effect of HMME-mediated photodynamic therapy on human keratinocyte. Methods Exponentially growing keratinocyte cell line Hacat was incubated with a serial doses of HMME(0-40μg/ml) for 1h or incubated with 10μg/ml HMME for various time(0-120min).Both of the HMME absorption were measured by FACS.To test the inhibitory effect of HMME-PDT, Hacat cell was incubated with HMME(2.5-40μg/ml) for 2h, then exposure to frequency-doubled Nd∶YAG laser(532nm, 20mW/cm~2)for 0, 2.5, 5, 10, 20min, respectively.Cell viability was assessed by MTT assay 24 h after PDT. Results The absorption of HMME by Hacat cells was increased with incubation concentrations and time.Light alone or HMME alone had no effect on viability of Hacat cell.The inhibitory effect of PDT was in proportion to the HMME concentration and light dose. Conclusions The absorption of HMME by Hacat cells is dose-dependent and time-dependent, and HMME-PDT have significant inhibitory effect on Hacat cells, the concentration of incubation and energy density are two important factors affecting the inhibitory effect of HMME-PDT.

9dw7DYuI.title: Photodynamic Therapy of Chlorin e4 Glycine Amide on Sarcoma 180 Transplanted in Mice
9dw7DYuI.abstract: Objective Chlorin e4 glycine amide,a new type of photosensitizer,made from chlorophyll of silkworm excrement,has been developed by College of Pharmacy of the Second Military Medical University.The purpose of this study is to evaluate the photochemotherapeutic effects of this compound on sarcoma 180 transplanted in mice. Methods Subcutaneous inoculation of sarcoma 180 was made on double or single armpit of the both sexes Kunming mice.When the tumors reached 6-8 mm in diameter,the tumor transplanted mice were randomly divided into several groups according to weight and di- ameter of tumor.Tumors were irradiated vertically with 630 nm(semiconductor laser)for 20 min at a power density of 150 mW/cm~2 [energy density(ED):180 J/cm~2]at 3 hours after intravenous injection in a dose of 5 mg/kg or 10 mg/kg.The tumor weight was deter- mined and the inhibiting rate of tumor was calculated 1 week after laser irradiation. Results Chlorin e4 glycine amide could obviously inhibit the sarcoma growth,the inhibiting rate of tumor in 5 mg/kg and 10 mg/kg groups after 630 nm irradiation was 35.5% and 39.0%,but after 661 nm irradiation it was 50.49% and 61.18%,respectively. Conclusions Chlorin e4 glycine amide has obvious anti-sarcoma effect on S180 sarcoma-bearing mice.

0qZ8I5Wi.title: Modulating mitochondrial morphology enhances antitumor effect of 5-ALA-mediated photodynamic therapy both in vitro and in vivo.
0qZ8I5Wi.abstract: 5-aminolevulinic acid mediated PDT (5-ALA-PDT) is an approved therapeutic procedure for treating carcinomas of the cervix. However, when employed as a monotherapy, 5-ALA-PDT could not produce satisfactory results toward large and deep tumors. Therefore, developing a method to improve the efficacy of 5-ALA-PDT becomes important. In this study, we demonstrate an enhanced antitumor effect of 5-ALA-PDT by the modulation of mitochondrial morphology. The mitochondria in the cells were regulated into tubular mitochondria or fragmented mitochondria through over expression of Drp1 or Mfn2. Then these cells were treated with identical dose of 5-ALA-PDT. Our results suggest that HeLa cells predominantly containing fragmented mitochondria were more sensitive to 5-ALA-PDT than the cells predominantly containing tubular mitochondria. The morphology of mitochondria changed as the cell cycle progressed, with tubular mitochondria predominantly exhibited in the S phase and uniformly fragmented mitochondria predominantly displayed in the M phase. Paclitaxel significantly increased the population of M-phase cells, while 5-fluorouracil significantly increased the population of S-phase cells in xenograft tumors. Furthermore, low-dose paclitaxel significantly increased the antitumor effects of PDT. However, 5-fluorouracil didn't improve the antitumor effects of PDT. These results demonstrated an enhanced antitumor effect of 5-ALA-PDT from the modulation of mitochondrial morphology. We anticipate that our results will provide an insight for selecting potential chemotherapeutic agents to combine with PDT for tumor treatment.

2Fg9RcY8.title: Fast linear confocal scanning photoacoustic dermoscopy for non-invasive assessment of chromatodermatosis
2Fg9RcY8.abstract: Medical imaging plays an indispensable role in clinical diagnosis and assessment of pathophysiological correlations in dermatology. However, the existing imaging techniques are limited to resolve the concentration and spatial distribution of skin melanin for chromatodermatosis. In this work, we developed a fast linear confocal scanning photoacoustic dermoscopy (FLCS-PAD) for label-freely visualizing the pathologic structures of pigmented lesion and quantitatively evaluating melanin content of pigmented abnormality. The FLCS-PAD was utilized for non-invasive and high-resolution imaging of epidermal conditions in Cafe-au-lait macules patients. Image results demonstrated that there was a significant difference between normal and Cafe-au-lait macules skin (p u003c 0.05). By implementing a fast linear confocal scanning mode, an individualu0027s photoacoustic pathological section can be quickly obtained with clinical score in ∼1 s. The FLCS-PAD might as well extend to diagnose other dermatological conditions, which ope...

t1HommkX.title: Structural and functional imaging for vascular targeted photodynamic therapy
t1HommkX.abstract: Vascular targeted photodynamic therapy (V-PDT) has been widely used for the prevention or treatment of vascular-related diseases, such as localized prostate cancer, wet age-related macular degeneration, port wine stains, esophageal varices and bleeding gastrointestinal mucosal lesions. In this study, the fundamental mechanisms of vascular responses during and after V-PDT will be introduced. Based on the V-PDT treatment of blood vessels in dorsal skinfold window chamber model, the structural and functional imaging, which including white light microscopy, laser speckle imaging, singlet oxygen luminescence imaging, and fluorescence imaging for evaluating vascular damage will be presented, respectively. The results indicate that vessel constriction and blood flow dynamics could be considered as the crucial biomarkers for quantitative evaluation of vascular damage. In addition, future perspectives of non-invasive optical imaging for evaluating vascular damage of V-PDT will be discussed.

xKi1grOs.title: A series of water-soluble photosensitizers based on 3-cinnamoylcoumarin for in vitro antimicrobial photodynamic inactivation
xKi1grOs.abstract: A series of novel water-soluble photosensitizers (PSs; M1–M5) based on 3-cinnamoylcoumarin derivatives, incorporating carboxylic acid salt (M1, M2), pyridine salt (M3, M4) and quaternary ammonium salt (M5) groups, were designed and synthesized. Their photophysical and photochemical properties and in vitro antimicrobial photodynamic inactivation (PDI) were investigated. M2, modified with two carboxylic acid salts, was unstable in phosphate-buffered saline (PBS). The four other PSs all showed higher binding/uptake to methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus (MRSA), A. baumannii and C. albicans compared with the clinical drug methylene blue (MB), except for M1 to A. baumannii. Furthermore, the three cationic PSs (M3–M5) exhibited equivalent antibacterial PDI efficacies against MRSA and A. baumannii compared with MB. The antifungal efficacies of M4 and M5 to C. albicans were both significantly higher than that of MB, especially for M5, indicating that the quaternary ammonium-salt-modified coumarin derivative has substantial potential for antifungal PDI.

61EsKGsR.title: Rabbit retinal injury and repair from 532nm laser irradiation
61EsKGsR.abstract: Objectives: To observe injury and repair effect of 532nm laser on rabbit retina,Methods: The 532nm laser was used to irradiate rabbit retina.The laser irradiation dose was 200J/cm2,duration was 100 seconds and spot diameter was 2mm.The funduscopy and light microscopic examination were performed at ld,3d,7d,14d and 28d after irradiation.Results:Dropsy and hemorrhage were obvious at 24h after laser irradiation.The border of the coagulation spots were clear and the scope of hemorrhage enlarged at 3d,and small amounts of fibroblasts also appeared in the choroid.At 14d,exudation and hemorrhage were absorbed basically.And fibroplasis and neovascularization could be obviously seen at 28d.Conclusions: The laser with this irradiation dose could damage retina severely.And there exists a certain rule in the process of retinal repair.

hnHKr3Wh.title: Effect of mental intervention on anxiety and delivery for the pregnant women
hnHKr3Wh.abstract: Objective:To study the effect of mental intervention on psychologically,physiological functions and delivery for the pregnant women in order to figure out the effective mental intervention.Methods:160 pregnant women scoring more than 40 based on particular questionnaires in clinic,were divided into experiment group and control group at random.Each of groups had 80 members.The mental intervention was given to the experiment group.Results:In both experiment and control group,blood pressure and anxiety were significant increasing but the condition of experiment group was better.The rate of uterine-incision delivery in experiment group was lower than control group.Conclusion:The anxiety of pregnant women has obviously progress during pregnant period.Effective mental intervention can ease anxiety,cut down the rate of uterine-incision delivery and raise the rate of normal parturition.

0GLT2WPV.title: Effect of preoperative mental intervention for anxiety emotion and quality of life in patients with different panhysterectomy
0GLT2WPV.abstract: Objective:To study the effect of mental intervention for anxiety emotion and quality of life in different panhysterectomy,in order to figure out the effective mental intervention.Methods:160 women who will receive panhysterectomy scoring more than 40 based on particular questionnaires in clinic,were divided into four groups,per vagina hysterectomy group,abdominal hysterectomy group,experiment group and control group at random.Each of groups has 40 members.Experiment group accepted mental intervention.Results:In experiment group,the disorder of anxiety and depress were significantly lower than those in control group(P<0.01).The differences of two group were most largest,anxiety were most in preoperative maximum,depress were most in post operation.Each index in per vagina hysterectomy group was approximated with that in abdominal hysterectomy group.Each index in experiment group were significant difference to that in control group.Conclusion:Anxiety and vital quality of women who endure panhysterectomy could be improved by effective mental intervention.

ff6u5Rzh.title: Study of cell apoptosis and cell proliferation in ectopic human endometrium
ff6u5Rzh.abstract: Objective To study the relation between cell proliferation and cell apoptosis in endometrium and endometriosisMethods Eutopic and ectopic human endometrium during the menstrual cycle were obtained from 61 patients.PCNA was examined by immunohistochemical mothod.Apoptosis cells were detected by TUNEL mothod from 34 patients.Results Apoptotic cells appeared as scatted grandular in secretory phase.The staining of PCNA protein in cytoplasm of glandular cells was mainly seen in proliferative phase.It rarely appeared in secretory phase and absent during menstruation.It appeared higher in endometriosis.Conclusion Apoptosis of endometrial cell is ralated to endometrium shedding.In order to extend its lifecycle,endometriotic cells decreased apoptosis and proliferated overly.

NBu584CR.title: Analysis of the Problems of Interest-linked Groups in Public Policy Implementation——Empirical Study on the SME Supporting Policy Implementation in Shaanxi Province
NBu584CR.abstract: Based on the analysis of the problems of the interestlinked groups in public policy implementation,this paper proposes that the public policy implementation is a process of adjusting and reallocating the public resources and balancing the interest among different groups.According to the resources they hold and ability of using the resources,different interest-linked groups will gain power and set obstacles for the public policy implementation.To resolve the problems.first of all,public policy implementation should be brought into a system;then,setting up the interest balance mechanism and interest compensation mechanism are also important.Finally,giving the dynamical support to the correlation group will guarantee a smooth public policy implementation.

qnJiQL5O.abstract: The evolution path of all subjects is "the practice-experience-theory", but the development of management theory is still under the "practice experience" "jungle" theory time. The paper thinks that "jungle" state of management theory caused by the idear of studies in practice and theory are confused in the research. The way to solve this "jungle" state of the path that lies in the introduction of the axiomatic method, to study modern management experience research and theoretical research division of implementation, so that modern management towards an integrated study, which continued out of the "re-manufacture of the wheels" of the jungle state.

9gBJjgnr.title: Composition and perfect of the SMEs service system in Shannxi
9gBJjgnr.abstract: Small and medium enterprises play an important role in the national economic development,and many countries have seen the development of SMEs as an important part of national development stratagy.But in the process of development,SMEs encounter all kinds of restrictions and need the supports from outside.This paper analyzes the problems existing in the process of SMEs development and the problems existing in the SMEs service system of Shannxi province,and brings forward corresponding countermeasures to compose and perfect the SMEs service system.

1cwgMCjI.title: The Evolution Tendency of Relation between China and EU:the View of Aids of EU to China
1cwgMCjI.abstract: This paper summarized the general situation that EU aid to China,the main characteristic is increasing the fund to aid progressively,the aid domain had changed from the early agricultural aid to economical and the social reform,defers to "the standardization" from beginning to end the request operation and so on.The present situation that EU aids to China,we discovered the political and economical logic happen to tally the position of the New Liberalism to carry on the essential intervention to the international politics and economic life,developing the European Union member nation and the European Union interior social experience in the aid country,causes their economical movement and the social development following the direction which European Union drew up to,this also exactly indicated the behavior of the European Union which aided to China is impossible to deviate the self-interest standpoint.But,China in persisted under the independent foreign policy and guideline,causes the relate between China and EU gradually developing to the practical direction,solves the common difficult problem in the cooperation foundation which is both sides already achieves the mutual recognition,seeks the long-term strategic partner relationship still is the development tendency between China and Europe.

dlRHxM5D.title: The Study of the Correlation to the Job Satisfaction and Organizational Commitment of the Knowledge Worker——An Example of technology enterprises in Xi'an Hi-tech industry Development Zone
dlRHxM5D.abstract: In the logical framework that personal characteristics affect job satisfaction,and job satisfaction affect organizational commitment,this paper used the technology enterprises in Xi'an Hi-tech industry Development Zone as an example to study the relationships between job satisfaction and organizational commitment.With the different conclusions drawn by previous studies,One-way ANOVA results show that the gender and professional of knowledge worker have significant impact on job,but each dimension and organizational commitment are irrelevant.The analysis of the correlation between Job satisfaction and organizational shows that the three dimensions of job satisfaction with the continuance commitment(F6) is no correlation.The conclusion is the job satisfaction that representatives of work-related attitudes,involving economic indicators such as wages and benefits index less,but a continuance commitment is founded on the basis of economic principles.Therefore,enhancing the organization's continuance commitment of employees is not only to enhance employee job satisfaction,but also need to enhance economic indicators such as wages and benefits to start.

0ZHNFCnC.title: The Path of Regional SMEs Entrepreneurial Model:Based on the Analysis of Experience in Shaanxi Province
0ZHNFCnC.abstract: The quantity and quality of SMEs depend on the entrepreneurial pattern largely.The paper researches the entrepreneurial pattern of SMES in Shaanxi Province researched as a case study analysis of the nature and deconstruction,which to sum up special with innovative technology,educational resources,characteristics of cultural resources,unique natural resources and the introduction of special resources of five kinds of entrepreneurship mode,hoping for regional small and medium-sized entrepreneurial mode selection and the evolution of the provision of empirical evidence.

3ZJkOFDf.title: A study on the choice of heirs of Chinese family firms
3ZJkOFDf.abstract: The heritage problem of family firms was more and more attended by the practicians and theoreticians.Whether the family firms can hold over favoring directly affects their development,and the heritage favoring mostly depends on whether they can choose the heirs effectively.This paper aimed on the choice of heirs of family firms,and based on the actuality of the choice problem of heirs,and deeply studied on the various factors that will influence the choice of heirs,so that to provide some suggestions for the firms to choose the right heirs that can fit their needs in reason.

IBvHqXRf.title: Japanese Circular Economic Strategic System and Its Enlightenment to China
IBvHqXRf.abstract: Japan is one of the earliest countries which undertaken the circular economic development mode and the countries which have the most complete circular economic strategic system and laws and regulations relevant to the circular economy, and highest efficiency in resource recycling. The experience of Japan is best of its kind for us to learn.

07h6iEjV.title: Empirical Analysis of Factors Affecting China's Rice Exports
07h6iEjV.abstract: Combining the gradual declining trend of rice exports,appreciations of the RMB exchange rate and export price fluctuations together,on the basis of existing researches,an analytical framework is constructed which relies on the relevant data from 1988 to 2003.By using econometric methods,the following conclusions are obtained:As factors affecting the rice exports volume,RMB exchange rate and export price fluctuations accounts for 81%,the other factors accounts for 19%,such as government export policies,economic situation of importing countries,trade barriers,tax rebate rates,and so on.So the main cause of rice export decline is the weakening of price competitiveness and appreciations of the RMB exchange rate.

2PEobMyN.title: A Study on Influential Factors of SMEs Business Starting——An Empirical Analysis of Shaanxi Province
2PEobMyN.abstract: This paper takes SMEs in Shaanxi Province as an example,analyses the advantages and the disadvantages in the pioneering stage of SMEs.After a comparative study between advanced East China and Shaanxi Province,we find out the gaps between these two areas.We think the institutions between SMEs and large enterprises are competitive.We find out their comparative advantages and disadvantages and establish a theoretical analysis framework on factors of SMEs business starting after comparison.We illustrate these achievements according to the investigation and empirical study.The key points are inner factors and external factors which have influences on SMEs business starting.Finally,we propose advice and countermeasures in promoting SMEs business starting.

y9P7aYqG.title: Studies on the Problems of SME Supporting Polices System An Empirical Analysis on Shanxi Experience
y9P7aYqG.abstract: In recent years,the function of SMEs has played an important role in the economy and the social stability development of a country however,the support policy of SMEs has not been attached importance to its contribution,which leads to the awkward situation of“strong power but weak strength”objectively.In the perspective of nature of SMEs,which needs supports and safeguards of the series policy.The paper takes support policy problem of Shaanxi province as an example,analyzing the problem of support policy in shaanxi province and proposing some suggestion,hoping to help some departments to make more scientific and reasonable support policy of SMEs and take more effective policy of execution,which could impel the growth of SMEs in the healthily.

hzr0CopW.title: Improvement on dupont analysis system of telecommunication company on EVA
hzr0CopW.abstract: To overcome the traditional dupont system defect in evaluating the financial situation of the telecommunication company,EVA is presented,and core index of EVA per share to form a new dupont system is raised,a case study is conducted.In the new dupont system,analysis of cash flow is added;meanwhile concepts of appreciation in assets accretion and sustainable development are applied to meet the needs of rapid economic development.Thus it will more appropriate for telecommunications company to analyze the financial situation.

XIrQlhSE.title: An Analysis on the Advantages and Disadvantages of Equipment Manufacturing Industry in Germany and China and Its Heuristic
XIrQlhSE.abstract: This paper take the development situation and characteristics of equipment manufacturing industry in Germany and China as the start point,uses the comparative research method to analyze the competitive advantages and disadvantages of in the equipment manufacturing industry.We explain the key factors which exert an influence on the development level of the equipment manufacturing industry of these two countries.According to the competitive advantages and disadvantages analysis,these two countries are complementary in the equipment manufacturing industry.We hope this paper can provide some valuable advice to the development of Chinese equipment manufacturing industry.

gDCgOxFM.title: Environmental Policy System and Implementation Mechanism and Its Enlightenment to China
gDCgOxFM.abstract: European Union is one of the regional organization with the highest degree of political and Economic Integration and the most complete environmental policy system which have been deepen with the economic and social development. The regional conflicts on the environmental issues, however, are very drastic, which is similar to the objective conditions of China in managing the environmental issues. Therefore, it is with a great value for us to learn from EU practices in environmental policy formulation and implementation, solutions to the conflicts between EU and its member states to best formulating and implementing our environmental policies and solving the environmental conflicts among different regions in China.

VOGslEGD.title: Effect of Entrepreneurs' Human Capital to Carving out Performances:the Angle of Comparing with Human Capital
VOGslEGD.abstract: The contributions of entrepreneurs' human capital to carving out performances have always been attended by mainstream of economics; however, along with the coming of the new economics, single human capital can't sufficiently explain the durative increase of enterprises, especially the performance distances of carving out enterprises. As a result, entrepreneurs' social capital begins to be emphasized by theory groups. The article takes carving out enterprises in Shaanxi for example, in the angle of comparing with human capital, analyzes the contributions of entrepreneurs' social capital to carving out performances, and makes classifying analysis of entrepreneurs' social capital and carving out performances by Principal Component Analysis. Then with carving out performances as explained variable, entrepreneurs' social capital and human capital as explaining variables, a regressive model is set up. The results demonstrate that entrepreneurs' social capital contributes much more than human capital and these phenomena are explained at the end of the article.

uqaHG7bw.title: A Study on the H-T Model in Reconstructing Equilibrium of Migrant Rural Labors in China—Take Fengwang Village in Xianyang City as Example
uqaHG7bw.abstract: This paper builds the H-T model in the equilibrium of migrant rural labors,and estimates the effect of the factors by econometric method.The empirical results show that increasing availability of peasant capital,improving approaches for obtaining information and enhancing the direction of rural education are the key points to rebuild the equilibrium of migrant rural labors.

eNrdk7vK.title: Survival benefit of an herbal formula for invigorating spleen for elderly patients with gastric cancer]
eNrdk7vK.abstract: Gastric cancer is one of the most common malignant tumors. Traditional Chinese medicine (TCM) has been widely used in treatment of gastric cancer, but still lacking large sample controlled trial to evaluate its efficacy.To analyze the prognostic factors of 220 elderly patients with gastric cancer, and to further study the efficacy of an herbal formula for invigorating spleen and it modifications based on syndrome differentiation of TCM in treatment of gastric cancer in elderly patients and the influence on prognosis.A total of 220 elderly patients aged 65 years or over with gastric cancer from Longhua Hospital of Shanghai University of Traditional Chinese Medicine, and Renji Hospital and Ruijin Hospital of Shanghai Jiao Tong University Medical College were prospectively enrolled. All patients were assigned to either traditional Chinese herbal medicine (TCHM) group (89 cases) or non-TCHM group (131 cases). Patients in the TCHM group were treated with an herbal formula for invigorating spleen plus chemotherapy, while patients in the non-TCHM group were only treated with chemotherapy.Univariate and Cox regression analyses were performed to determine all the potential prognostic factors. Kaplan-Meier curves were used to assess the differences in survival time between TCHM group and non-TCHM group after stratification for TNM stage, surgery or chemotherapy.The 220 eligible patients were histologically confirmed adenocarcinoma of the stomach from 2001 to 2007. Eighty-nine cases in the TCHM group received three or more months of TCHM treatment, and 131 cases in the non-TCHM group did not receive TCHM treatment. Cox regression analysis suggested that the TNM stage, radical resection, three or more treatment cycles of chemotherapy, and TCHM treatment were independent prognostic factors (P<0.01). The patients receiving TCHM treatment demonstrated better prognosis than the other prognostic factors in multivariate analysis; the odds ratio [Exp(beta)] of overall group was 0.322, and 95% confidence interval (CI) was from 0.212 to 0.489. Median overall survival of TCHM group was 41.129 months, and one-, three-, and five-year survival rates were 85.2%, 55.6% and 45.7% respectively. Median overall survival of non-TCHM group was 17.195 months, and one-, three-, and five-year survival rates were 63.9%, 26.9% and 21.9% respectively. In stratification analysis of stage for 96 patients who did not accepted radical resection or suffered from recurrence and metastasis (36 cases in the TCHM group, and 60 cases in the non-TCHM group), Cox regression analysis suggested that three or more treatment cycles of chemotherapy and TCHM treatment were independent prognostic factors for improving survival respectively (P<0.01). The hazard ratio [Exp(beta)] of TCHM in stratification for late stage was 0.421, and 95% confidence interval was from 0.255 to 0.693. Median overall survivals were 17.819 months for TCHM group and 8.548 months for non-TCHM group. In stratification analysis of surgery and chemotherapy for 102 patients with Ib-IV (M0) who accepted radical resection (R0 resection) and three or more treatment cycles of chemotherapy (33 cases in the TCHM group, and 69 cases in the non-TCHM group), the disease-free survival and overall survival did not reach the median at the time of analysis. In the TCHM group, one-, three-, and five-year disease-free survival rates were 97.0%, 59.9% and 50.4%, and one-, three-, and five-year survival rates were 100.0%, 74.1% and 61.4%, respectively. In the non-TCHM group, one-, three-, and five-year disease-free survival rates were 82.6%, 51.1% and 51.1%, and one-, three-, and five-year survival rates were 86.9%, 55.6% and 55.6%, respectively.The herbal formula for invigorating spleen has an important value for improving the prognosis of elderly patients with gastric cancer. This herbal formula show survival benefit for advanced gastric cancer in elderly patients. The influence of TCHM on disease-free survival and overall survival of postoperative gastric cancer in elderly patients need to be further evaluated.

H4PsGWH7.title: Clinical Research of Survival Benefit for Patients with Unresectable Liver Metastases from Colorectal Cancer Using TCM Treatment based on Syndrome Differentiation
H4PsGWH7.abstract: Objective:This research aimed to evaluate the survival benefit of TCM treatment based on syndrome differentiation for patients with only and unresectable liver metastases from colorectal cancer.Methods:A total of 74 patients with liver metastases from colorectal cancer were divided into 2 groups:36 patients received TCM treatment based on syndrome differentiation with conventional medical treatment(integrated traditional and western medicine group),38 patients received conventional medical treatment only(Western medicine group).Cox regression analysis was performed to determine all the potential factors which may affect prognosis such as age,gender,primary site,pathological type,transferable type(synchronous or metachronous),chemotherapy,radiotherapy,palliative treatment of primary tumor,interventional therapy of liver metastases and TCM therapy.Results:Cox regression analysis suggested that the primary site(P=0.041)and TCM therapy(P=0.000)were independent prognostic factors.The hazard ratio [Exp(β)] of TCM therapy was 0.319,and 95% confidence interval(CI)was from(0.177,0.575).Median overall survivals(OS)of Western medicine group were 12.00 months.Median OS of integrated treatment group were 25.55 months.There was significant difference between the two groups(P=0.000).1-,2-,3-,4-,5-year OS rates of Western medicine group were 14%,6%,0%,0%,0%,respectively.1-,2-,3-,4-,5-year OS rates of Integrated therapy group were58%,35%,15%,15%,15%,respectively.Conclusion:TCM treatment based on syndrome differentiation is important for improving the prognosis of patients with liver metastases from colorectal cancer.Integrated treatment shows benefit for prolonging survival for patients with liver metastases from colorectal cancer.The influence of integrated treatment needs to be further evaluated.
keywords: TCM treatment based on syndrome differentiation

QWGrHT8t.title: Study on Measurable Diagnosis of Grades of Spleen-deficiency Syndrome in Patients with Advanced Gastric Cancer
QWGrHT8t.abstract: Objective: To study the correlation between symptoms of spleen-deficiency syndrome and blood examinations of advanced gastric cancer,and to explore the method of the measurable diagnosis on spleen-deficiency syndrome.Method:To divide patients into deferent spleen-deficiency degrees with integration method.To compare the blood examinations' results differences with variance analysis,and to establish the judgment formulas by Fisher discrimination analyses.Results:289 patients were divided into three groups,non-spleen-deficiency group(n=99),light-spleen-deficiency group(n=120) and medium-spleen-deficiency group(n=70).19 items of all the examinations were showed the significance difference among the three groups.The values of most of the parameters analyzed increased in accordance with Spleen-asthenia syndrome degree,among these parameters,weary,anorexia,abdominal-flatulence,marasmus, edema,leukocyte,serum albumin,AKP IgG and α_(1)globulin were demonstrated to be relatively valuable indices.Then a diagnosis discrimination model was set up,and samples rechecked by the model showed a concordance rate of 92%.Conclusion: The quantitative evaluation of symptoms and examinations of advanced gastric cancer can provide reproducible data for differential diagnosis of the Grade of TCM syndrome.The discrimination model established here may be of measurable diagnostic value.

cZn2uZI5.title: 72 Cases of the Large Intestine Cancer Treated by TCM Recipe "Wei Chang An"
cZn2uZI5.abstract: Objective:To observe the function to the large intestine cancer treated by TCM recipe "Wei Chang An" which tonifies the spleen.Methods:We collected 72 cases of post-operative large intestine cancer treated by TCM, west medicine combined group and west medicine and analyzed the five-years survival rate and one-year, two-year metastatistic rates of these three groups. Rusults:The five-year survival rate of TCM and west medicine combined group are 77.66% ,75.25%. They are obviously higher than the rate of west medicine group; The one-year, two-year metastatistic rates of TCM and west medicine combined group are 14.17%, 18.13%. Obviously lower than that of west medicine group.Conclusion:Recipe "Wei Chang An could effectively improve the five-year survival rate of postoperative large intestine cancer a.nd decrease their one-year, two-year metastatistic rates.

YZJWiCDi.title: Growth-inhibiting and anti-metastasis effects of Weichang'an Decoction on orthotopic transplant nude mouse model of human gastric cancer]
YZJWiCDi.abstract: To evaluate the growth-inhibiting and anti-metastasis effects of Weichang'an Decoction (WCAD) on orthotopic transplant nude mouse model of human gastric cancer.Forty-one nude mice were implanted with SGC-7901 cells at orthotopic site, whereas 25 were implanted with SGC-7901 cells subcutaneously. Then the nude mice in each transplantation model were divided into the same three groups which were WCAD-treated group with WCAD 0.5 ml/d taken orally, 5-FU-treated group with 5-FU 50 mg/kg intraperitoneally injected weekly and untreated control group with physiological saline 0.5 ml/d taken orally. The growth-inhibiting rates of transplant tumors were detected and the metastatic lesions were examined in the orthotopic transplant mouse model while PCNA-positive rate and apoptotic index (AI) were observed in the subcutaneous transplant mouse model.The growth-inhibiting rates in the WCAD-treated and 5-FU-treated groups of orthotopic transplant mouse model were 40.82% and 37.92% respectively whereas those of subcutaneous transplant mouse model were 48.70% and 60.10%. The incidence rates of metastasis in perigastric lymph notes, lymph nodes in the porta hepatis, liver, diaphragm and peritoneum in the WCAD-treated and 5-FU-treated groups were lower than those in the untreated control group, and the total metastasis rates in the WCAD-treated, 5-FU-treated and the untreated control groups were 30.77%, 28.57% and 71.43% respectively with significant differences (P<0.05). The total PCNA-positive rates in the WCAD-treated and 5-FU-treated groups were obviously lower than that in the untreated control group (P<0.05 or P<0.01) while the AI was higher than that in the untreated control group (P<0.01). The growth-inhibiting rate, total PCNA-positive rate and total metastasis rate in the WCAD-treated group had no significant differences as compared with those in the 5-FU-treated group, but the AI in the WCAD-treated group was significantly higher than that in the 5-FU-treated group (P<0.05).WCAD has the inhibiting effects on tumor growth and metastasis of gastric cancer which is orthotopic implanted onto nude mice. This effect may be obtained by proliferation suppression and apoptosis induction in cancer.

PpkYs9RB.title: Effect of "Weichang'an Decoction" on growth and hepatic metastasis of orthotopic transplant in nude mouse
PpkYs9RB.abstract: Objective To evaluate the inhibitory effect of "Weichang'an Decoction" on the growth and hepatic metastasis of orthotopic transplant in nude mouse models of human colorectal cancer.Methods The nude mice were implanted with HCT116 cells at orthotopic site,then randomly divided into four groups: control group,Weichang'an group,5-Fu group,Weichang'an+5-Fu group.Each group was treated with corresponding intervention.The mass,volume,growth-inhibiting rate of orthotopic tumors and the metastatic lesions,the pathomorphology of orthotopic tumors and hepatic metastasis,the concentrations of CEA and AFP were detected.Results The orthotopic tumor formation rate was 100% in each group.Compared with the control group,the mass(P<0.01) and volume(P<0.05) in 5-Fu group and Weichang'an+5-Fu group were decreased significantly.The growth-inhibiting rates of orthotopic tumors in Weichang'an group,5-Fu group and Weichang'an+5-Fu group were 19.087%,33.298% and 36.802% respectively.The incidence rates of metastasis in liver,abdominal wall,mesentery et al in Weichang'an group(P<0.05) and Weichang'an+5-Fu group(P<0.01) were lower than the control group obviously;the total metastasis rates in control group,Weichang'an group,5-Fu group,Weichang'an+5-Fu group were 100%,50%,72.72% and 40% respectively.The concentrations of CEA in Weichang'an+5-Fu group were lower than that of the control group significantly(P<0.05).Conclusion "Weichang'an Decoction" has certain inhibitory effect on the growth and hepatic metastasis of orthotopic transplant nude mouse model of human colorectal cancer.Combination of "Weichang'an Decoction" with chemotherapy shows better results.

Gy8z0Cne.title: Inhibition of tumor cell proliferation and induction of apoptosis in orthotopic transplanted gastric cancer SGC-7901 by Wei Chang An
Gy8z0Cne.abstract: Background: Wei Chang An (WCA) decoction (Chinese herb medicine preparation) could increase the 3-year survival rate of patients with advanced gastric cancer and could enhance apoptosis and suppress tumor cell proliferation in human gastric cancer subcutaneous xenografts in nude mice. Aims: To appraise the inhibitory effects of Wei Chang An on the growth and metastasis of orthotopic transplanted gastric cancer SGC-7901 in nude mice and to study its effect on tumor cell proliferation and apoptosis induction. Methods: The stability of WCA preparation was monitored by HPLC. Orthotopic transplanted gastric cancer SGC-7901 model was used to evaluate the inhibitory effects of WCA on tumor growth and metastasis. Tumor cell proliferation was assessed by PCNA and apoptotic index was determined by TUNEL technique. Results: The tumor inhibition rate of WCA in this model was 40.8%. The total metastasis rate was 30.8% in WCA group, whereas it was 71.4% in the normal saline control group. The liver metastasis rate in WCA group was 7.7%, much lower than that in the control group (50.0%, P<0.05). The PCNA positivity rate and total positivity rate in the treatment group (51.0%±11.4% and 60.4%±13.3%) were significantly less than those in the control group (61.6%±11.6% and 74.4%±7.9%, P=0.0287 and P=0.0029). The apoptotic index was much higher than that in the control group (17.3%±8.9% vs. 7.8%±3.0%, P=0.0010). Conclusions: WCA decoction has inhibitory effect on the growth and metastasis of orthotopic transplanted gastric cancer SGC-7901 in nude mice. The mechanism is probably related to its inhibitory effect on tumor cell proliferation and induction of apoptosis in vivo.

kl3ef1pT.title: Colorectal Cancer Syndrome Analysis of the literature
kl3ef1pT.abstract: Objective:To analyze 10 years of colorectal cancer syndrome differentiation,and to explore evidence-based distribution of the objective law.Methods:Statistical analysis from 1998 to 2008 between TCM diagnosis and treatment of colorectal cancer literature.Results:The most common is two card portfolio.Spleen Deficiency in the process of occupying plays an important position,Syndromes followed by yang deficiency of spleen and kidney,intermingled deficiency of spleen,dampness-heat diffused downward,yin deficiency of liver and kidney,deficiency of both qi and blood,accumulated blood stasis-toxicity internally,deficiency of spleen,qi stagnation and blood stasis,accumulated toxicity due to dampness-heat.

Gl1BQFqr.title: Effects of Chinese herbal recipe Weichang'an in inducing apoptosis and related gene expression in human gastric cancer grafted onto nude mice]
Gl1BQFqr.abstract: To investigate the mechanism of Chinese herbal recipe Weichang'an (WCA) in inducing cell apoptosis of human gastric cancer grafted onto nude mice.The high performance liquid chromatography was used for monitoring the stability of WCA. A human gastric cancer cell line SGC-7901 grafted in nude mouse was used as the animal model. The mice were divided into untreated group and two experimental groups. Animals in the two experimental groups received either WCA over a 34-day period or 5-fluorouracil (5-FU) over a 6-day period starting at the 8th day after grafting. Animals in the untreated group received normal saline on an identical schedule. Animals were killed 41 days after being grafted. To assess the effect of the treatment on tumor, the tumor weight was determined by the electron balance immediately after the animals were killed. SP immunohistochemical method was used to detect the expression of proliferating cell nuclear antigen (PCNA) in grafts. Apoptotic indices (AI) of the tumor cells were examined by terminal deoxynucleotidyl transferase-mediated deoxyuridine triphosphate fluorescence nick end labeling (TUNEL) method. SP method was also used to detect the expressions of cleaved caspase-3, caspase-8 and caspase-9. SYBR green dye I real-time quantitative polymerase chain reaction (real-time quantitative [corrected] PCR) was used to assess the related gene alterations in mRNA level. The expressions of phospho-Stat3 (Tyr705) and bcl-2 proteins were detected by using SP method.Compared with the untreated group, tumor growth was significantly inhibited by treatment of WCA or 5-FU (P<0.01, respectively). The tumor inhibition rate in the WCA-treated group was 48.70% and that in the 5-FU-treated group was 60.10%. The average labeling index (LI) for PCNA in the WCA-treated group and 5-FU-treated group was significantly decreased as compared with that in the untreated group, respectively. The AI of human gastric cancer grafted in the nude mice detected by using TUNEL method was significantly increased to (9.72+/-4.51)% in the WCA-treated group, while it was (2.45+/-1.37)% in the untreated group. 5-FU-treated group was also found a significantly increased AI compared with the untreated group. The expressions of cleaved caspase-3 and caspase-9 in the WCA-treated group and 5-FU-treated group were significantly increased as compared with those in the untreated group. But caspase-8 showed no significant alteration either in the WCA-treated group or in the 5-FU-treated group. The expression levels of Stat3 (2(-)delta delta C(T))=0.16) and bcl-2 (2(-)delta delta C(T))=0.10) detected by using real-time quantitative [corrected] PCR were lower in the WCA-treated group than those in the untreated group. The expressions of phospho-Stat3 (Tyr705) and bcl-2 in the WCA-treated group were significantly decreased as compared with those in the untreated group.Chinese herbal recipe WCA can inhibit gastric cancer cell SGC-7901 growth in vivo, induce gastric cancer cell apoptosis and suppress the cell proliferation. WCA induces apoptosis through the caspase-9 and caspase-3 pathway in vivo. Its mechanism might be involved in the down-regulation of Stat3 and bcl-2 genes.

Psy31ogC.title: Chinese Reports on the Effect and Safety of FOLFOX or FOLFIRI for Advanced Colorectal Cancer
Psy31ogC.abstract: Objective:To evaluate the effect and sanfety of irinotecan versus oxaplatin combination with 5-FU/CF for patients with advanced colorectal cancer.Methods:Articles on the two systemic chemotherapy for advanced colorectal cancer published in 2000—2008 were retrieved using the Keywords:"colorectal cancer","chemotherapy","irinotecan"or"oxaplatin"from"Vip Chinese Science and Technology Periodicals database", then the whole text was read to get all-related information.The data were descriptively analyzed.Results:There were 283 articles on irinotecan versus oxaplatin combination with 5-FU/CF for patients with colorectal Cancer, 16 of which on FOLFIRI were included while 96 of which on FOLFOX. Among the articles statistically studied, median survival time were reported in 33, time of tumor progress in 30.The response rate of FOLFOX4, FOLFOX6, and other oxaliplatin-related regimens was 26.1%~57.14%, 33.3%~48.6%, and26.5%~60%, respectively.The response rate of FOLFIRI was 12.5%~48.2%. Conclusion: The effect of FOLFIRI or FOLFIRI for advanced colorectal cancer are in agreement with those reported abroad.However, there ara certain shortcomings in the application of regimens and the design of domestic clinical studies,thus affecting the results of studies.

SVJIwTgt.title: Weichang'an and 5-fluorouracil suppresses colorectal cancer in a mouse model.
SVJIwTgt.abstract: To examine the effect of Weichang'an (WCA) and 5-fluorouracil (5-FU) on colorectal tumor and hepatic metastasis in a mouse model.Quantitative determination of hesperidin, the effective component in WCA decoction, was performed using HPLC. In vitro cytotoxicity of WCA was determined by treating HCT-116 cells with WCA diluents or serum extracted from rats that received WCA by oral gavage for 1 wk and MTT assays. Forty-eight nude mice received cecum implantation with tumor blocks subcutaneously amplified from human colon cancer cell line HCT-116. Mice were randomly divided into four treatment groups: control (CON), WCA, 5-FU and combination (WCA+5-FU). Pathological examination of tumors consisted of tissue sectioning and hematoxylin and eosin staining. Tumor weight and size were measured, and the number of metastatic lesions was counted. Serum carcinoembryonic antigen (CEA) level was determined by ELISA. The expression levels of tumor genesis and metastasis-related proteins β-catenin and matrix metalloproteinase (MMP)-7 were measured by real-time quantitative reverse transcriptase polymerase chain reaction (RT-PCR), immunohistochemistry and immunoblotting. Cell fractionation was used to investigate intracellular distribution of β-catenin.Parenchymal tumors were palpable in the abdomens of nude mice 2 wk post-implantation and orthotopic tumor formation rate was 100% in all groups. 5-FU treatment alone significantly decreased tumor weight compared to the CON group (1.203±0.284 g vs 1.804±0.649 g, P<0.01). WCA treatment alone reduced the rate of metastasis (50% vs 100%, P<0.05). Combination treatment of WCA+5-FU was the most effective, reducing the tumor weight (1.140±0.464 g vs 1.804±0.649 g, P<0.01) and size (1493.438±740.906 mm3 vs 2180.259±816.556 mm3, P<0.05), the rate of metastases (40% vs 100%, P<0.01), and serum CEA levels (31.263±7.421 μg/L vs 43.040±11.273 μg/L, P<0.05). Expression of β-catenin and MMP-7 was decreased in drug-treated groups compared to controls, as detected using real-time quantitative RT-PCR, immunohistochemistry and immunoblotting, respectively. Cell fractionation assays revealed that nuclear translocation of β-catenin was reduced by WCA and/or 5-FU treatments.Combination of WCA with 5-FU significantly inhibited colon tumor growth and hepatic metastases. Decreased expression of β-catenin and MMP-7 may be important.
